<Content>We had no Problems! My boyfriend and I stayed at the Select Club portion of the Grand Paradise, and we book thorugh Sunquest. We were there from March 31st - April 7th, 2008.Both of us have never been anywhere in the Caribbean before, so we dont have anything to compare it to, however, our trip was great!We did hear that a lot of people had issues with thier rooms, but our room in building #7 was great. We did request a king sized bed, and got 2 doubles, but not a big deal. the room was huge, clean, maid service was great, no bugs, great AC and a fan as well. The only thing that could have been better was that there was no phone or alarm clock in the room.Our pool at the Club was great because it was never too busy, and the swim up bar was fantastic. All the other pools were always nice and clean as well, and it goes without saying, that the beach was fantastic. Obviously it was crowded and yes, you do need to put towels on chairs early, but I'd imagine that you need to do that at every resort.The food was great, the buffets were great. The hours kinda sucked at the Club's buffet (closed between 10-12:30 and 2:30- 5:00), but if you were hungry, you could always go to the buffet at the Beach portion, which was always open. As for the A La Carte's, we ate at the Seafood one and the Asian one, and they were good. Just a warning though, you cannot wear flip flops to the a la carts, you must wear nice shoes. My shoes were open toed, but they were nice. The Seafood restaurant turned away a lot of people for wearing flip flops.My boyfriend and I didnt find it a big deal taking the little train to the Beach resort, it really wasnt a long walk there, and it was a nice walk. You could always just start walking and if you see it come, you can hop on in the middle.Just outside of the resort was a little market to buy some things at. I wouldnt recommend going there by yourself, and get ready for pushy pushy people, but if you hold your own and bargan strong, you will be ok. It's an interesting experience.Really, the only 2 issues that I would complain about would be that the Reception Staff should be a bit more competent. Going to the reception for whatever reason was never a pleasant experince, for most people there.Also, it would be good if the resort had more things to do when it rained.Other than that, great experience. I would stay there again, I would recommend it to others, and I am definatly going back to Punta Cana another time.

<Content>Loved the Beach! Grand Paradise Bavaro Beach, Punta Cana-March 29-April 5/08fHotel-My husband and I found this hotel in a sunwing travel book. We chose this particular hotel mainly because of the pictures of the resort in the travel magazine. The Pool was close to the beach and many palm trees on grounds and at beach and palapas on the beach as well. There was 5 a la carte restaurants and 1buffet restaurant with access to the newer section of the resort called Le Club with l a la carte restaurant and 1 buffet. Only 3 choices of a la carte per week. The price was right!!!Hotel-Upon arrival we knew this hotel was a 4 star hotel compared to other hotels we stopped at on our trip from airport to our hotel. We thought the grounds were sufficient upon arrival with the entrance to lobby attractive, but, nothing elaborate. We were met at hotel with friendly staff and escorted to our room by two friendly staff members.Room-We were supposed to have a king size bed as we booked VIP gardenview, but, we were given 2 double beds. The location in building 5 was a good one, so, we decided not to complain. Room was large, not new furniture, problem with shower head in bathtub, but, fixed with no problems next day. The room was clean, no mildew, but, could stand a little facelift. We decided for the money that the room was sufficient for us as we did not plan to spend much time in it. Problem for us was having to use bottled water to brush our teeth as you could not use tap[ water.Pool-There are 2 large pools on the property, the only complaint is that the pool is 5 ft. deep and hard to do pool aerobics or pool volleyball in it. Temperature of pool was nice, no pool mats to lay on in the pool, missed that feature. Can be quite loud by pool in late afternoon with music and entertainment. Lots of pool lounges around both pools, just have to get to them real early in morning with your towel, then leave, like everyone else does.Pool at Le Club much nicer, only 4 ft. deep with swim up bar and pool volleyball, nice temperature. much quieter here than beach pool. Take a shuttle from main resort to Le Club-5 minute trip. Everyone from the resort can use either pool location.Beach-The entire beach in Punta Cana is stupendous. I have been to every island in the Caribbean, and, this is the best of them all. White sand runs for miles and miles, great for walking on, turqouise water. Unbelievable til you witness it yourself!Food-There are 5 a la carte restaurants on this resort, Italian, Asian, Steak House, Seafood and Dominican and 1 Buffet restaurant. Our best meals were at Seafood and Asian. We had good service, not 5 star service, but, was not bad. The staff at each restaurant were for the most part very friendly. The buffet for breakfast was good with enough choices for anyone, dinner just okay, I am not a buffet type person at any time of the day. The steak house during the day serves lunch which was handy because it is beside the beach and pool. Lunch food was repetitive but could always find something to eat.There is a new section to this resort called Le Club, which has 1 a la carte restaurant and 1 buffet and everyone can use these facilities as well. Larger selection of food at buffet here,Entertainment-Nightly shows held in a rather nice building with large capacity. Bar located inside building. Shows were somewhat professional, dancing was very good, costumes good, emcee of shows quite hard to understand while introducing each event. Pool entertainment was not too organized, beach volleyball was played each afternoon. pool aerobics hard to do in 5 ft. pool unless you are very tall. Shopping-There is a market right outside the main entrance to this resort, probably 50 little market shops. You will be able to get just about everything you will want to buy as a souvenir here, from hats, jewelry, shirts, etc. Make sure you haggle price, 1/2 the given price and then reduce again. Walk away at your price and they will either say yes or no, just go to the next one and do the same. You will find someplace that will take your price.Resort-This resort caters to French Canadians from Montreal, Ottawa, France, so, if there is a problem with this issue, do not go to this resort. We would say 70% of the tourists at this resort were either from Quebec or France. French language is heard at all times. The staff seem to cater to them a little more, I guess because they make up the majority. I can say that I never had a problem or issue, and, for the most part I got along with the entire staff of this resort without speaking a word of French. We thought the Resort to be quite informal and relaxing, not too large, so it makes for a more intimate setting. Grounds need a little TLC someplaces, but, overall, quite pleasant for the price paid. Most places were clean and found workers cleaning the beach and working on the grounds. Le Club, which is newer, is much nicer with nice grounds and flowers, trees, everywhere.Excursions-We only went on Saona Island excursion, but, had a little problem with morning pickup, but, the day was pleasant what with the catamaran ride and speed boat ride. Little confusing at times finding our guide, but, all in all, a great dayWe were signed up for snorkeling with sharks and stingrays, but, it was too windy and was cancelled. There are loads of excursions one can take and the price appears to be always around the $85.00 p.p price. You have to make your own decisions on this matter whatever turns your crank.Overview- We thought for the money we paid-last minute-that we got what we paid for - a 4 star resort. We thought the resort was very people friendly and not too large-we like this-staff was very friendly to us, room was okay, food was good-not great, beach and pool were great, market outside grounds was convenient to shop. All in all 7 out of a 10.P.S. My only complaint on this holiday was the SunWing Representative at the Hotel. Not too people friendly and fails to do her job booking excursions and dinner reservations. Had to complain to her on both accounts, but, she denied responsibility and blamed other people at hotel for confusion. Ya Right!

<Content>Let's Just Say That We Won't Be Back! First of all, there is a big difference in Bavarro and Punta Cana. Punta Cana is expensive, but top notch. Bavarro is NOT! The beach was absolutely gorgeous and if you like sunning and swimming, this is for you! After two days of going to the beach, I was bored. There really aren't any places nearby to go unless you take an excursion and none were to my liking as they are very limited. The acommodations are about as 4 star as a Motel 6. We had problems with our toilets and we were in a 3 room suite. Two toilets broke and luckily my other half was able to fix. The sheets didn't smell, but you could see that they were very worn and thin. The sliding glass door in our room had a huge crack on one side that started from the top and went down to the bottom. We reported this, but nobody seemed too interested. We avoided going out on the lanai in fear that the glass would eventually give out and hurt one of us. The food was not very good, but there was always a variety. Their health standards are not what the U.S.'s is and I believe that this is why I was so sick for three days out of seven. It wasn't food poisoning, but it sort of reminded me of having cholera, if you know what I mean??!?!? They also did not have any metal loaf shields for cutting the loaves of bread, so people were just holding one end with their hand and cutting slices off with the other. The Chinese restaurant was the best place to eat, but it wasn't outstanding by any means. If you like rum drinks or beer, you are in luck. The wines (red and white) came in plastic gallon jugs (like milk), so I didn't try it out. In the restaurants you could order bottles of wine and they were very good. I ordered a bloody mary one day and it tasted like tomato paste with the same thick consistency. I couldn't even drink it. I have to say that we had no problem with the service staff that we encountered and all were very nice. We could only endure one nightly show because it was that bad. However; we did get a big laugh out of it because it was so lame. I have seen elementary school children put on a better show. Of course, the actors (if that's what you want to call them) were the same people you would see during the day acting as servers, chamber maids or activity directors, so it wasn't their fault, but hilarious none the less. I would never go back here, but than again, I am a traveler that doesn't care much for being trapped in a compound-like area. If you want to go and tan and drink all day long, this is the place for you. My next trips will revolve in the USA and no more all-inclusive places either.

<Author>BytownSunseekers
<Content>Good Value for the Price We booked a four-star wild card package through Go Travel Direct for March break and assumed that we would end up at the Club section of this resort. Instead, we were assigned to the main section next to the beach. That worked well for us (two adults and two children).The main section appears to be one of the original resorts on the Punta Cana stretch of beach. Consequently, it's showing its age a bit. The rooms are OK and kept clean but they could use some updating. Our beds were very old and one of the two was in rough shape. Over the course of the week, we saw workers bringing in new beds so it appears that this problem is being dealt with. A/C worked fine. Bathtub drain very slow which seems to be a common problem in Caribbean resorts. Safe key and TV remote are available through the front desk.Food was fine. The buffet restaurant has a nice and varied selection. We booked three speciality restaurants over the course of the week and they were all good. As others have noted, they're not five-star restaurants but we weren't expecting that. The decor in each was nice, the service was pleasant and the food was good. When you order filet mignon, just don't expect a true filet. But, all in all, a fun experience.The beach is fantastic and compares well with Varadero in Cuba and Playa del Carmen in Mexico. It's very crowded but we generally found shaded areas around the pool and then made regular forays into the ocean with the kids. Both my daughter and my niece loved playing in the waves.Go Travel Direct advertises this resort as a four-star. I'd say it probably was a four-star originally but now is more like a three or three-and-a-half star. Considering that we paid about $1,000 a person including taxes and fees, we found that the resort was a good value. However, if we had paid the full price, we might have been a bit disappointed.One disappointment had nothing to do with the resort. We lost one full day of our vacation due to a one-day delay on March 9th supposedly due to the big storm the day before. We woke up very early Sunday morning to discover that our flight with Zoom Airlines was delayed until Monday morning. However, I noted that the other charters made it out of Ottawa on Sunday with delays of a few hours only. I have complained to Go Travel Direct but have not yet heard back about any compensation. Zoom also changed our return flight with days to go from a 2:30 afternoon departure to a midnight departure. Very disappointing since it made for a difficult return trip.

<Author>rndmintz
<Content>BE CAREFUL!!! When we booked our recent vacation, it was listed as Grand Paradise Bavaro - but after booking we were informed that it was actually at the Club Grand Paradise Bavaro and that theyare the same resort. Just to be clear - they are two separate resorts on the same property and only one is actually on the beach - the Club is in behind the main part of the resort and is a 10 minute walk to the beach. So be very careful where you book - although we did meet a couple who were moved after they showed up from the main part to the Club section and were told this was allowed by the hotel as it was the same resort. So it seems it doesn't matter how carefully you book as you may end up walking to the beach anyway.For this reason alone I would not recommend this resort and I wouldn't return.Having said that, the Club area has beautiful pools and is near enough to the beach that it is practical to spend every day on the beachfront. The beach is beautiful and the water is warm. The beach cabanas go early so you should arrive by 6-6:30 to ensure you secure one if you want any shade during the day.We enjoyed the food and ended up just eating at the buffet every evening. It was somewhat repetitive but we enjoyed the variety they had available.Our room was nice and clean with some flaws ( a light was hanging by a wire and the towel racks were half falling off the wall) but we only slept there so didn't really care.Hot water was sketchy and some folks didn't have any all week. Overall, we enjoyed a week on the beach but would choose another resort where the beachfront is guaranteed rather than return here.

<Author>buppa6805
<Content>Great Vacation First, I have to say I was very nervous about staying at this resort because of some of the reviews I read on TripAdvisor. I booked this vacation through RCI for my family and another family and it was great. We stayed at the main resort in building #3 and not the Club. My family, two adults a toddler and an infant, had a room with two double beds and got a crib for our baby. Our friends, two adults and a toddler, had an adjoining room with a king size bed and a crib. The rooms were clean and equipped with a small refrigerator. I thought getting cribs may be tough but it wasn't difficult at all. The maid service was fine and our beds were turned down nightly. You should get two room keys because one needs to be plugged into the wall to turn on the air conditioner and lights. A safe key will cost you $20 U.S. We didn't get the safe and took our valuables with us in a knapsack. The a la carte restaurants were very good. Is the food the same quality as the U.S.? No, but it is very good for the Caribbean. The service was good, some better than others but not bad at all. I would definately recommed Taino, the Domincan restaurant, Michelangelo, the Italian restaurant. The Manglar is an International restaurant at the Club and is excellent. The buffet is very busy and sometimes it is hard to get service, but if your willing to ask the staff for help they will generally respond quickly. We made our reservations for the a la carte restaurants early in the week and ate before 7 pm so we didn't have any problems with reservations. Every resort I have been to has been the same in that you have to make your reservations early. The pools are warm, clean and huge. The beach is absolutely beautiful. As most of the reviewers have said, if you want a lounge chair in the shade then you need to get up a little earlier and reserve a chair. We were able to get the same general for the week by putting towels out around 7 am. There is no swim-up pool bar at the main resort but there are a couple at the Club. The pool bar at the main resort is busy but the Brugal Rum and Coke Lights were excellent. The Bahama Mama's weren't bad either. They also had kiddie cocktails! We didn't stay out late at night but there was always entertainment at the piano bar and the drinks were good. I definately recommend the Mamajuana! The Club was a short walk, or trolley ride, away and seemed more quiet than the main resort. There was some construction but I didn't notice any noise or other problems. I didn't get to see the rooms at the Club but it was definately new and seemed very nice. The pools were beautiful!All in all I having nothing but good things to say about this resort. The staff treats you as you treat them. They were great with our children and loved the baby. Smile, say ola and gracias and they will treat you right. A small tip goes a long way too! Just remember you are on vacation to relax and enjoy life!

<Author>sunandsun
<Content>Great spot for a relaxed vacation This a great hotel--service was wonderful, people friendly and beach amazing! We read all the bad reviews and were a tad worried--remember that this hotel houses more or less 2000 people ( which sounds like a lot but they're well spread out) Some people were unhappy--that will happen anywhere you go! We asked for an ocean view , paid extra for it (about an extra $100 each but a great investment)and got it in building # 6 which is about 50 yards from the beach. The room was pristeen clean, we always had hot water and a turn down service with fresh cold water to drink (everything on the resort is done with purified water--you can't drink from the taps--but other than that the fruits, vegies and plentiful drinking water is available) Presidente is the beer of choice as were many other drinks, inclusive.If you like to chill on the beach, walk the pristeen white soft sands and relax, this hotel/beach will do it for you. It's small enough not to be overwhelming and is charmingly laid out. The main buffet restaurant has enthusiastic waiters/hostesses and the food is good---with a fair amount of variety. The Italian (Michelangelos) is the best a la carte, followed by the Asian. We learned how to snorkel in the pool (a great lesson) and took advantage of the plentiful land/water exercise classes. The staff are sexy eye candy and full of fun and mischief. We took the tour of the Marinarium ($83 US each) which is a 1/2 day snorkling and tour adventure--very cool --you get to snorkel in a conservation area with Nurse sharks and stingrays--coral and coloured fish. The crew ( Hola Captain Sharkey !) were full of fun, and the music made you want to dance (Bob Marley, etc) and the crew danced with the passengers. They were having as much fun as we were.This was our first trip to Dominican. If you go off resort, you do see the poverty, and there is a lot of renewal and construction going on outside--the Dominicans are beautiful people and know that tourists only help their economy. There is an artisan flea market about 100 yards from the front gate...you can bargain for everything from t shirts to rum, jewellery etc. There is another one that's an hour walk up the beach, we didn't go but heard it was great. Be willing to bargain--it's a game, but be fair and pleasant and you'll have fun. Back to the hotel-- Bring lots of $1 tip money and be generous--bring extra dollar store items for your maids--spread our Canadian wealth around and you will be rewarded with big smiles and muchos gracious. Bring a spanish/english dictionary and learn some basic words like--por favor--which is please. Go. Enjoy. This is a nice hotel.

My family went there in Jan/07 for 1 week and here is the complete resort rundown......... After you land, you'll wait endless for no reason as the airport is very hectic. Plan on 2hrs at the airport. After you get your baggage on the free carts, you are allowed to use them for 25'. Then they are taken away by airport employees (or maybe they were just entrepreneurs) and the public bag handlers want $4 to carry your bag 100' to the buses. Just do it and relax. First tipéˆ¥ï¸¹â‚¬îš­et an ice cold 6-pack of beer for the 30min bus ride from the airport, as the new highway is not done yet, and that seriously helps to smooth out the ride. Take turns heading to the bar to make that wait easier and also look into available booking at the specialty restaurants while you wait. There was 5 of us on this family trip. 3 kids ages 9,7,4. The kids had non-stop fun. Kids Club was awesome. The 3 ladies running it are truly great. Food was 4-star in quality. Nightly shows were OK, not great. My wife says the guys were hot and the dancing was really good. The women were easy on the eyes. Yes there is a bar in the theatre guys, enough said. Beach was big, beautiful  white and the waves were huge (4'-10'; yes, rogue waves were 10') all day long. There were surf boards 1/4 mile off shore every day, all day. NOTE: The plastic cups they give you are incredible small, so bring your own like we did, big 24oz cups worked best and make sure it has a cap on it to avoid sand getting in it). To get choice seats at beach and pool, just put your towels down at 7-8am and you'll be happy. The specialty restaurants must be booked within 1 hr of your arrival to pretty much guarantee your selections. Most are only 4 stars in quality too. Chinese was 4.5 stars. Activity program is good, I did then all. Pool exercise was really good. Please note that this is primarily a family resort. If you are single and looking to hook-up or party all night long, then go somewhere else, you will not have fun here (four 18yr old Italian guys were there for just that purpose and they were bored and acting really stupid by weeks end). The disco is small and I never used it. There is no casino. There are about 15 slot machines. The 24hr bar has the Foose-ball table and pool tables. Both were in great shape. The internet computers are there too. This is a good resort for single ladies to book into who really want to be left alone. Both of our rooms were clean and in good working order. Premier Section is over 1 mile from the beach, which you can not walk to. Golf course is VERY close and great. Take a $6-8USD taxi ride to get there. The native drink of the Dominican Republic is known as mamajuana and amongst Dominicans; this tasty drink has gained somewhat of a mythical status. Legend has it that mamajuana acts as somewhat of a cure all from everything from éˆ¥æ¸“a gripeéˆ¥?(the Dominican term for the flu) to a variety of ailments ranging from prostate to ovarian disorders. <Author>anderlooOttawa
<Content>Busy resort and beach Never been to an all-inclusive before, so that left my expectations reasonably low. The Grand Paradise was very nice - and it seemed to fit the DR environment - not ritzy, but clean enough for North American travellers. My wife and I found the hotel to be comfortable, but the public areas (buffet restaurant, pools and beach) to be quite busy. The property is building more units (the Club), so it will get even busier in future - no beach chairs, and sunbathers all over so you had to navigate your way from one place to another. There was a shuttle back to the Club end of the property, but cannot understand why anyone would want to stay far from the beach if you travel all that way.Food was decent, but the a-la-carte was better, and the fish was terrific (try the white bass). Tennis courts are in poor shape for anyone who takes the sport seriously. The staff was great - from the cleaning ladies to the aerobics and dance instructors, but try some Spanish on them to get their attention - it works. Loved the evening entertainment - not Vegas but fun...We used Go Travel Direct - everything was great with their transportation and arrangements - even had an extra day after a snowstorm up in Canada disrupted the schedule. Whoo whoo!

It's too bad the owners are looking more at the $$ side of the business instead of offering a good quality service and experience.

<Author>BramptonSnakeyes
<Content>Great resort, Good food, Perfect beaches This will be one of many, many reviews about the Grand Paradise Bavaro, all I can say is read many reviews as you can, weigh out the pros/cons, take it with a grain of salt and decide for yourself.Unlike some of these reviews, I had no issues with my room, it was clean, and had no smell, and the bathroom was fine. We did not have a problem with the cleanliness of it. The maids were good, always left us extra towels.The food, it has been said before, this is not FINE dining, however, having said that, the food was WAY better then what some of the reviews had said before I left. I was PLEASANTLY surprised at the food. It was tasty, and there was variety..and when you got tired of the buffet, there was always the a la carts that were avaiable. The snack bar at lunch where they served pizza, hot dogs, burgers etc was also available. Again, not FINE dining, but the kids enjoyed it. We were a group of over 20 people...and sorry to those that were there the same time we were ( Dec 29-Jan 12) but I believe we finished all the HOT DOGS the first week !!! They were excellent !!Things to do: You MUST go to Saona Island, its the picture in the post card that you see all the time...the place does exist !! Water is spectacular, and swimming with the STAR fish was an absolute treat for the kids !! The other tour we did was the  Monster Truck tour. We went to a Haitian village ( if there is one thing I wish I had known was to bring stuff..). The poverty is shocking. We were able to stop off at a little gift store before we went, and bought some hair clips, pencils, pencil crayons etc...these people need EVERYTHING. So my advice, please bring any little hotel room shampoo bottles, soaps, tooth brushes, if you can, bring down any old summer clothes that you are done with...they need it all...The shows at night time were very entertaining ( for those of you who complained, MY LORD, THIS IS NOT BROADWAY !!) but the animation team put their best efforts into it !! Hi DARIO ( the MC)..HI DAVIDE (the dancer/aerobics instructor )).....Was very friendly, they all were....the kids enjoyed themselves.Overall, this was a great trip for us and the kids and the rest of our party....For those of you setting your expectations of being on FANTASY Island,and being served like a king.. I would say WAKE UP....The hotel is clean, the food is good, the people are friendly, what more can you ask for??? The staff was amazing and the snorkeling was great.One thing that we had to get over before leaving on the trip was their standard of a 4 star is not the same here - so if you're expecting the Hilton you're going to be disappointed. There will be problems - you are going to run into something you don't like - but it's how you deal with it or at least that's what we found. Either way this trip was amazing, lots of great memories and we would recommend this hotel to friends.

I've come to the conclusion that those who gave this resort a high rating must have very low expectations.I have never vacationed with the expectation that it will be perfect but I do expect that any major hiccups will be attended to in a reasonable fashion.Here is my story:We arrived at the club portion of the resort in the evening and waited in line to check in for an incredible time due to the fact that many of the guests had paid for the beach front resort area but were sent to the club, which is a 10 minute walk from the beach.When we arrived in our ground level room, we found that the safe didn't work, there was one 3/4 bed and that the door to the adjoining room wouldn't lock (We opened it and found ourselves standing in someone else's occupied room!!).We were told that we would be given another room the following day and went to bed. We were awakened at 3 a.m. to water running from the ceiling of the bathroom. I called front desk and about 4 a.m. a maintenance worker arrived and proceeded to tear the ceiling out of the bathroom. After about 20 mins. he explained that he couldn't do anything until the morning and left.I called front desk for another room, but none was available, so we put our gear on the coffee table and went back to bed, lulled off to sleep by the sound of running water.Front desk advised us to come for our new room at 10 a.m., then noon, then 2, then 4, then 5. Finally, at 6 p.m. I was told that there was no room available for us. I asked what we were to do, since our room was torn apart, but the attendant just shrugged and blamed his supervisor for lying to us about a room being available.After quite a heated situation, suddenly a room became available!! I'd be making another choice.My rating reflects the fact that this resort failed miserably in attending to simple maintenance problems and failing to provide satisfactory service in the aftermath.Add to this, the fact that I found the night security staff sound asleep on 4 different occasions, my rating for safety is very low as well.

<Author>KSD1
<Content>Great time but go with an open mind. My friend and I stayed at the Grand Paradise Bavaro the week of November 3-9th and we had a great time. I read the reviews of this resort and had my reservations about going. A lot of reviews were just negative and didn't provide any details as to why. I found some of the reviews to be of great help and I hope I can do the same. I will try to break it down as best as possible.AccomodationOur room was a good size and was clean. We were in building 5 on the 2nd floor. We had no real complaints. As a note, their elevators are far and few between so if you have difficulties with stairs, you should keep this in mind when getting your room. If you can, try to stay in the 2nd lobby. It was an upgrade (about $20 extra) and well worth it. There are two lobbies at this resort. The second one is where all the amenities are such as the resturants, access to the beach, the disco, sports bar, casino, nightly shows, etc. We brought a little thank you prezie for our chamber maid and gave her a $2 USD tip each day. (Note: bring some $1's for tipping, it's not mandatory in any way but the people really appreciate it.) there is a trolley that runs between the 1st and 2nd lobbies and run every few minutes.ResturauntWe ate at the main resturaunt for most of our meals. We never went hungry but they offered the same dishes almost every evening. They did change the meals a little each evening but there were only a few changes. At lunch you have a choice between the grill and the resturaunt (and sports bar i believe)however, at the grill they offer hot dogs, fries, and hamburgers pretty much every day. Again, you will not go hungry. The a la cart resturants are pretty good. My friend and I went to the Seafood and the Italian and enjoyed them both. (Oh, i forgot to mention, for breakfast, if you like omelets, be sure to stop by that station, their omelets are quite tasty). Neither of us got sick from the food but as a note, bring all of the stomach relief medication you can think of. It's safe that way and you don't have to think twice about buying stuff down there. My friend and I went over board with it but we figured we'd rather have it and not use it than not have it at all.Pools/BeachThe pools are nice. The entire pool is 5ft deep all around so for short people that don't know how to swim, you may not like it. I'm 5'2ish (ok, 5'1ish) and I don't know how to swim but I felt comfortable walking around (on my tippy toes - lol). Note: there are no life guards at the pool or the beach so you should keep that in mind if the water concerns you. the pools were not overly crowded when we went, we were always able to find a chair. Now the beach was amazing. We were only able to go in a few times the week we were there but that was due to a previous storm which caused the waves to be rough. I'm sure by now they've calmed down. The sand is white and the beach is very clean. If you are going down with children, note, going topless is allowed (though some people, men and women shouldn't be but I won't go there - lol).ServiceI didn't have any issues with the service. I found everyone to be very helpful and kind. The language barrier is an issue but you can always get by. There is a gentleman in the resturant named Juan, he was the greatest. Such a nice man and a very hard worker. I found everyone I spoke with to be very helpful. I attempted to speak Spanish when I could but my spanish isn't the best. To be honest, it's non-existent. I was able to get by with a few phrases. It would be a good idea to learn a few key phrases so you can get by. The front desk was very helpful too.Misc.Here are some other points I will mention that don't really fit in a category.Rent a security box for about $20USD (in your room). It'll give you a peace of mind.Bring a bigger plastic cup for your drinks - so you don't get one of those little cups that look like a zippie cup and you won't need to keep going to the bar.Don't forget your stomach medication - you'll be thankful if you need to use itRoaches - we didn't see any bugs at all and our room was very clean but we brought raid just incase. It doesn't hurt to bring it, if you don't need to use it, consider it a bonus.Market - we went to the market located just outside of the resort (about 3mins walking distance) - if you don't like being harrassed this may not be the place for you. There are a lot of nice things at the market but people will bombard you asking you to come to their stall. Keep your patience and understand that they are just trying to make a living. But haggle as best as you can because I found some of their prices to be quite inflated. For example, I bought a ring which started at $90USD for $20USD. Excursions - there are quite a few excursions so keep that in mind when thinking of how much money to bring. They run between $40USD - $115USD. Currency - For Canadians - Though they do accept CDN currency, they do not recognize that the dollar is almost at par to the USD. When we went in Nov, our dollar was worth 10 cents more than the USD but this didn't matter to them. This may have changed since early November so you may want to confirm with your travel agent.That's about it but just as a note, this is considered a third world country so if you are going there with the highest expectations, chances are you will be disappointed. I had a wonderful time and I would go back in a heartbeat. The people are kind and the country is beautiful. You have to go with an open mind. Now with all this said, I heard a couple of people complaining about their situations so you should really think about what you are going for and what you want and find a place that can provide this for you. If anything, you can call the resort if you have further questions.Have fun and play safe!

<Author>paulaw07
<Content>One of the best holidays ever! Myself and my friend have just returned from a fantastic 2 week holiday at the Grand Paradise. This was my second time in Punta Cana but this time was definitely the best!Check-in - we arrived at the resort and were greeted with cocktails which was a nice touch. There was no delay in checking in and we were in our rooms within 10 mins of arriving at the resort. I asked for a top floor which we were given as I had read reviews that if it rained, the ground floor rooms become flooded. It only rained one night for 10 mins.Rooms - the rooms were very spacious and comfortable. There was a mini fridge in each room which was stocked daily with soft drinks. And if there were no drinks there, the cleaners went out of their way to get you more. The rooms were cleaned daily although some mornings, they came too early and came into the room while we were sleeping. Other than that, it was fine. We had the air con going all the time which was nice when you came back from a day in the heat! The TV also had some good channels with movies to watch every evening while we got ready to go out. The bathroom was fine although a little musty but always had hot water and good pressure in the shower. Restaurants - I had read alot of reviews about the restaurants before I went to Grand Paradise so had some idea what to expect. There are 4 restaurants - buffet, La Cana, Asia and Michaelangelo. You can go to the buffet any evening but you must make reservations for the others. When you arrive at the resort, you get 3 reservation vouchers per week. You must fill these out and go to the reception area anyday between 10.30 and 3.30 to make your reservation for the week. We absolutely loved the Asia restaurant and went there 3 times over the 2 weeks. The italian was nice also although basic. Stay away from La Cana - it was terrible. I dont know what meat they used for the steak, but it definitely wasnt beef!! La Cana is nice during the day for lunch or snacks after midnight. The buffet itself was good and has everything even mashed potato and gravy!! The service was excellent and the waiters were very friendly. Especially Jose in the chinese!During the day, we ate at La Cana which was a buffet and had pizza, burgers, hot dogs, french fries, toasted sandwiches etc. A really good selection which was impressive and again, the waiters here were always friendly and singing!!Night Life - hmmm, well we are 2 girls in our 20's and found the nightlife to be a bit of a disaster at the resort. There was an evening show every night with the entertainment staff dancing and different themes every night. I found this really good but I like that sort of thing! Some of the dancers were absolutely fantastic and i found it very enjoyable. They also had a pre show where they had karaoke etc. I think the staff get commission on getting people to sing so get up there! Its all fun!! There is also a piano bar which has a guy on a keyboard and a woman singing. Actually preferred when they played cds of music I knew as I found the guy on the keyboard to be very boring. Onto the disco!! At first, we werent very impressed as it was all Spanish music and nothing that we could dance to. We asked the DJ to play some american music and he gave us a request sheet and played the songs we wanted. After a few days, the disco actually became really good with the help of rum!!! The entertainment staff would also go to the disco and they got everyone in the mood and always got people dancing. Leodus, Raldy and Wilde to name but a few were great fun!! People usually left the disco to go to another nightclub outside the resort Mangu - we didnt go there as we were nervous about leaving the resort at night.Pool area - the pool is absolutely gorgeous. We set up camp near the pool bar and had entertainment and music all day although they played the same music but I loved the songs so it didnt bother me too much! There was entertainment in the mornings and afternoons with dancing lessons and volleyball in the morning and aqua gym and spanish lessons in the afternoon. The staff here were Dario, Bon Bon, and David and can I just say that Dario and David were absolutely great fun and made it really enjoyable. They had a Dominican party every Friday where they would dress up and dance with everyone. We miss them loads!!!Beach - the beach is the most beautiful beach that I have ever been on. It is so amazing, I cannot describe. We spent alot of time there also. There are people going around offering tours etc and are really friendly. You can also have your picture taken with a monkey or parrot for $8.Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my holiday at Grand Paradise Bavaro and would run back there in a heartbeat. I am very open-minded and have read all the reviews including the bad ones. I dont understand how people can put down the resort. Yes, its cheap and cheerful and may not be the same standard as other resorts but it was so much fun and had the nicest people there. I stayed at Sunscape previously. This was a much better standard but.... the staff at Grand Paradise make it what it is!! Dont read the negative reviews - go there and see for yourself!!!

First off I went to the grand paradise sept 8th-15th of this year (07) with my mom my cousin and my aunt for a girls week. We flew with sunwing out of Toronto and it was an amazing flight! We got to the hotel at 11:30, and we knew checkin (since it's stated right on the hotels website) was not until 3:00pm. We were told to leave our luggage with the bellboys and go to the pool or explore. We decided to go get changed into our bathing suits and go to the pool! We changed in the bathrooms that are NEAR the main lobby, there are no washrooms right in the lobby, it's down one corridoor to another. The washrooms were beautiful, all stone tile, and flowers everywhere. Very clean, and only one stall had some water on it. Nothing to complain about. We then went down to the beach to get some chairs, and even though it was 11:30am , we had no problem getting a spot under an umbrella. The pools are beautiful, the beach is gorgeous, and both are very clean and well kept. The beach bar isnt a swim up, the swim up bar is at the club grand paradise which is farther away from the beach and i think thus whhy they get that luxury. But the beach bar is literally 5 steps from the stairs to the pool, it was fine for me. The service at the beach bar was amazing, dont forget to tip! these guys work 12 hour shifts and when the beach bar closes at 11, they are there until 2 am, on hands and knees SCRUBBING the floors and every inch of the bar itself, we made friends with some of the staff and witnessed this all first hand. At 3:00pm we went up to get our rooms and there was no wait and no problem, infact some people that flew in with us had already gotten their rooms EARLY! hte bellboys took us up to the rooms and they were amazing. they are fairly plain, a few pictures on the wall, but VERY clean. The bathroom was great, not a spot of water, no leaks, TONS OF HOT water.. i am boggled that some people in the reviews below had no running water... Keep in mind sunwing and sunquest and LARGER tour groups own certain blocks of rooms, and you get what you pay for. Our fridge didnt leak, we had a balcony and we only paid for a garden view... we had an ocean view, it was just amazing!!! They have so many poolside activities, from contests, to beach olleyball, water aerobics, spanish lessons and water polo, we were always doing something, they have a kids club, i met another canadian with a little boy and he loved it! they are not stingy on the alcohol whatsoever, infact a lot of the time i had to say JUST A LITTLE VODKA haha they like to fill it up halfway, you really get your money's worth if you drink. The pool and beach are soo clean, the poolside does get slippery, so wear flip flops, i didnt fall ONE TIME! The food is great! i had no problems! my cousin, who is the most picky eater i know found something everynight at the buffet, and loved the beach restaurant for lunch, they have hamburgers and hotdogs and pizza, the pizza was awesome! the a la carte restaurants were great, i went to chinese and seafood and my cousin and aunt went to italian we loved all of them, GREAT service and great food. and we booked with our sunwing rep and had no trouble getting reservations for every one we wanted to try! the staff is really overworked, and they make about 40 american dollars a month. So remember to tip... a vacation is what you make of it, and if you expect to be waited on hand and foot and have everything emmaculately spotless and perfect, dont travel!! especially to a third world country! I had NO complaints about ANYTHING, the only staff i had a problem with was the girl in the gift shop. and it was my mother that had a problem not me. we tipped our made 2 dollars a day, and gave her little things we prebought at the dollar store like makeup and hair clips. She loved it, and appreciated it, and one day when i came back up to get another towel, she had both beds across the room cleaning under them and the walls!!! I never saw one mouse, or bug or anything for that matter in my room or any part of the resort! It was so clean and such an amazing experience. the staff is so friendly, if you're friendly. Try and speak spanish, even if it's a little, they find it entertaining and they respect you for it! The disco was fun too, the entertainment staff are there dancing with the guests, teaching dances, and it's a great time. The sports bar is open 24 hours it's a fun time too! and for internet you simply pay at the front desk and you get a little ticket that has a log in code on it, and you can use it all week until your minutes are up. I had no problems with the internet whatsoever. Overall, this resort is amazing. I'm actually confused about if the other reviewers were at the same hotel! I dont have one complaint, it was a great time and we are planning to go back the same time next year for 2-3 weeks instead of one! same hotel because it was just amazing! We went during hurricane season but it's also hte hottest month of the year, we only had about 7 minutes of rain, it was the beautiful weather and i reccommend this resort for anyone and everyone!

<Author>geonewyork
<Content>you get what you pay for My wife and I took our 4 children, ages 3-9 to Grand Paradise fo ra week in June. I would say overall it was a good value for what I paid (about $600 per person for airfare, 2 rooms, food  drinks), but it wasn't as nice as most of the other places my wife and I stayed at before we had kids. Here's a summary of what we experienced:The transfer from the airport took almost an hour because we stopped at many other hotels before ours, but the bus had good a/c and was comfortable. Check in was very quick because there was no line, however I requested 2 connecting rooms weeks before arriving, even e-mailed the hotel manager and he said we'd get them. But we were given rooms across the hall from each other. They said come back in 2 days, we'll have connecting rooms. When I did they then said come back in 3 more days, so we just kept the rooms we had.Rooms: We stayed in bulding six overlooking the pool, good location. The rooms were a decent size, but there was only one tiny dresser in each, so we just lived out of our suitcases. The a/c worked very well, and our beds were very comfortable. The shower was fine. We did have a few small roaches each day but they didn't bother us compared to the disgusting ones we have in NY. Maid service was fine. Never lost power even during the biggest thunder storm I ever experienced. No room service at all, no drinks in the room refrigerator other than a gallon of water, if you want to have cocktails or beer in your room you have to go all the way to the lobby or sports bar. One night I ordered 6 beers to go at the lobby bar and they looked at me like I had 3 heads. Also, the halls have no rugs and are like an echo chamber, if you're a light sleeper plan on getting woken up often. Food: The food was average at best. Breakfast is only at the buffet restaurant, lunch is there as well also at an outdoor place by the beach. There is a huge variety and you may be able to find something you like, just go as soon as they open, they can get very crowded and seating more than 2 people together can be difficult. If you stay for a week you get 3 vouchers for the table service restaurants. The chinese place was ok but it must have been 95 degrees in there. They let us book the Italian for the night of the week they're closed, we didn't find that out until we got there. The Domincan themed place, called Taino, was pretty good but had nothing our kids liked, also it's outside so no a/c, if you like sweating on your food you're in for a real treat. The late night snacks the hotel claims to offer consists of popcorn or awful nachos like you get at a movie theatre, both availble only at the sports barDrinks: If you're particular about your booze you are probably going to be disappointed. The only beer is a local brand served in small plastic cups. Cocktails are mostly local rum/fruit juice, I don't remember seeing any other hard liquor. No frozen drinks either. A six pack in the gift shop goes for $18.00 US. The Sports Bar is a small room with a 5 or 6 seat bar, one tv in the corner and a few games.Pools: the pools at the main part of the hotel were very good, we all loved them. However one day we took the tram to the Club section to go to their pool, it was so dirty you couldn't see past your knees, it looked like milk! We left right away.Beach: The beach was incredibly beautiful, one of the best I've been on including Hawaii, Cancun, Bahamas, Aruba. No problem getting shaded lounges although it was off season.Staff: Overall friendly, just be nice and try to know a few basic Spanish words and you'll be fine, Tipping the bartenders helps get you better service when it's crowded.Summary: I think it was a pretty good value and our kids loved it since they had no expectations, if you go there just remember it's not a 5 star hotel, there's a reason it's one of the cheapest all inclusive in Punta Cana. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!  
<Date>Aug 28, 2007

The biggest issue we had with any kind of language barrier was with the other guests at the resort.(And, for the other reviewers info. they are not mainly Europeon's they are Brazillean's, Cuban's, and Puerto Rican's.)I would break it down to 10% Americans, 10% Europeons, and 80% of the 3 other countries I mentioned above.3)FOOD - Breakfast - We went to the buffet each morning (thats really the only option) There is a HUGE variety. If you can't find something to eat I really don't know what to say about that. Try the crepes and omelets, they are made to order and are excellent.Lunch - offered daily at the main buffet and at La Cana Grill down by the beach. We ate at the latter because it was so convenient and you could go in with your bathing suit on with just some shorts and flip flops. They offer a salad bar, a panini maker with coldcuts and cheeses, hamburgars, hot dogs, rice and beans, excellent roasted chicken, fries, and pork chops or fish alternating daily between the latter 2. We were hooked on the chicken it really was delicious.Dinner - Again the buffet offers a huge selection. There were six of us and we always found something good to eat. The pasta station was excellent. We tried 3 a la carte's and I would rate them in order of preferance as the Asian, Italian and the Steak House last. (very poor quality steak).Service - I would have to say that out of 23 meals we maybe had to get up for our drinks 4 times. They do not just refill your empties, they take your drink order at your table and bring it to you. ( a dollar tip goes a long way with these waiters, they will remember what you drink and bring it automatically when they see you). Overall the food is good.4) ROOMS - Perfectly adequate and clean. My only complaint here is that I wish they changed the bed linens more. HINT- bring a few scented candles and a small can of Lysol, there is a slight musty smell when you arrive because they do not run the a.c. when the room is vacant.Keep one room key in the slot near the door so that the a.c. stays on all day, it helps with musty smell. 5)BEACH CHAIRS - I went down each morning by 7a.m. to lay out our towels on the 6 chairs, it was necessary if you want to get under a hut, but I would say, as long as you do it by 9a.m. you will be fine. The sun is extremely hot so you need a hut. I also brought along the clip on umbrellas from home just in case we couldn't get a spot in the shade, so that is a good tip.6) RUDE VACATION CLUB EMPLOYEES - This is probably the only thing I agree with. Be prepared to be hassled every day except Sunday, when you go into the main buffet. They are very aggressive, and by the third day my husband finally had to be rude in return to them. Our friends actually went to the presentation, and were seriously considering buying into the vacation club (20 weeks for $7,000.00 U.S.) They didn't though.7) PRIETO TOURS - We booked with Liberty so we used Prieto for our transfers to and from the airport. They were very prompt and professional as was Victor, the representative at the resort. He is there each day (except Wed.) between the hrs. of 8:30 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. He was very honest about the tours they sold and even told us that the Lobster and Shopping tour was not worth going on. That's honesty!! He was very nice.I hope I covered all of the prior negative reviewers complaints for you and put your mind at ease. I think sometimes people forget that they did not book a 5 or 6 star resort, but they expect to receive that level of service. If you want luxury and pampering do not book this resort. If you want value and a solid 3 star, book the GPB, you won't be disappointed. My tips would be, bring plenty of sunscreen, after sun aloe cream, first aid kit (band-aids, neosporin, etc.), aspirin, lysol, candles, toiletries, and Off bug spray for the mosquitoes.Bring about $100.00 in 1 dollar bills for tipping, we went thru about $90 in ones. Also bring a lot of 5's, 10's and 20's, because it is easier for them to make change.Tip the maid $1 a day for each guest in the room. They do not make a lot of money. Bring little things for her like nail polish, shower gels, powders, candles, etc. Leave a note saying for you gracias, room #. Otherwise they cannot take it.Rent a safe for $20 per week for valuables. (This can be done at the front desk). Visit the Punta Cana market village at the entrance to the resort, and bargain with the merchants. Store #3 had the friendliest merchant and she was not pushy like the others.Go with an open mind, the Dominican People are lovely and they really are very poor. You'll see what I mean when you ride to the resort from the airport. Give them a break, be friendly to them and I guarantee they will treat you right.We all had a wonderful time, nobody from our group got sick from the food, (maybe the people who do get sick, get sick because they drink too much)!!In closing, I wish you and your families a great stay at this resort, and please do not hesitate to e-mail me with any questions. Back to work tomorrow!!!! I miss the beach already!!!!!!!

<Author>PaFluffy
<Content>Great vacation for the price We have just returned from an 8 day vacation at Grand Paradise. We all had a really nice time, in spite of all the horror stories previously posted. The resort itself is really nice. It is clean and they really work hard to make you comfortable. The food isn't bad and not outstanding either. There is a variety, so if you go hungry it is your own fault. Make your reservations for the restaurants as soon as you arrive. The seafood restaurant fills up fast, so you may not get in. There is a bit of a language barrier, but you are in a foreign country, so you should expect it. Brush up on some Spanish words and you should be just fine.The beach, it was awesome. The water so blue and sand so white. The waves were calm during the first few days we were there, then by weeks end they were stronger. We loved it. It was very hot there, so we spent our days at the beach enjoying the water. There was entertainment every night in the theater. The shows were different each night. Some better than others, but it was very entertaining. The staff worked hard both here at the theater and in the restaurants. Bring dollars for tipping, they deserve it. Don't forget about the maids either, they did a good job with our room, so we tipped them as well.If I had a chance to return to Punta Cana, I would probably stay in another resort, only because we like to stay in different places. There wasn't anything wrong with this place. For what you pay, it was really worth it.

Temp was 87 to 90 degrees the entire time with very high humidity. We stayed in building #6 room #6226. Perfect location overlooking the pools, and ocean view as well as central to everything else. Thanks to another Advisor members advise we had asked for Building #6. Thanks. The beach was beautiful!! Water perfectly clear and gorgeous. Rained three times at night only. Now our only complaint, but it's a BIG ONE. THE FOOD. We only liked the Steakhouse Restaurant. Also used luncheon meats extensively. Very creative. <Content>Stayed at WAY better hotels before... My boyfriend and I just came back from this hotel for our one week vacation. (May 19th to the 26th). This hotel was the worst I have stayed at. If you have booked your trip - don't worry too much - its too late now and just make the best of it - however if you are considering this hotel, there are MUCH better ones in the same. Below I've put some points below of what my boyfriend and I thought:Pro's*the BEACH - definitely the best beach - even compared to the gran bahia and rui palace (which seemed like much nicer hotels) - there was no seaweed and the water was crystal clear - other hotel beaches have seaweed and the sand is not as nice -so one thing I do give it is the beautiful beach*The Staff- the people are very nice and try to accommodate your needs - I never had a problem with anyone (although I do speak Spanish). Con's *Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper - you can hear everything from people closing their doors (banging actually) to your neighbors, people above you, etc, etc *The hotel overall is very very old -and it has not been maintained properly - I'm surprised to see it was only built in 2001 but it feels at least 10 yrs old - don't get me wrong, the hotel itself wasn't very dirty but toilets had seats missing, things were cracking, we didn't have hot water on some occasions, air conditioning didn't work - it was just a fan,etc.*The food - was mediocre - the resort really lacked variety - the same foods were basically served each day - I was bored with the food within 2 days - and even my boyfriend who is the least picky eater i know - he eats anything and everything - agreed that the food was mediocre at best.Note: we actually went to all the restaurants as by accident we were given 6 vouchers for the restaurant instead of the 3 you get per week - so we went to the Italian (it was OK), Dominican (also just OK), Grill (the best of the 5 ), Asian ( not bad) and Sea Food (just OK). This made eating a bit better b/c I could not face the dinner buffet much longer - email me if you want to know how we got the 6 vouchers - by accident.I could go on forever on other things - if you want to know more then email me. Overall, I would never return to this hotel or recommend it to anyone. The staff were nice and they were trying their best but it really was not a 4 star hotel. I would recommend the Melia Tropical or the Marien Coral (in Puerto Plata) - these ones were much much better.

<Content>Grand Paradise Bravaro was grand My husband and I were married 4/28/07 and this is where we spent our honeymoon. We stayed 5 days and 4 nights. Eventhough previous reviewers did not recommend this resort for honeymooners, we enjoyed ourselves. We stayed in building 5. The room was very welcoming. Each room at the hotel had either a balcony or terrace. You must specify your view, either ocean, pool or garden. It was beautiful watching the sunrise and set. Our terrace was a extremely romantic spot. As a honeymooning couple we were presented with a bottle of rum and a large basket of fresh fruit, consisting of pineapples, papaya, apples, bananas, watermelon and grapes. The maid had the towels made in different animal shapes each day. We did encounter one problem. We requested a stopper by phone for our jacuzzi. It took them an entire day to deliver it after my husband went to the desk and complained about the service.  The sports bar was open 24 hours. Another problem was accessing the internet @ the sports bar. There were only two working computers. The hotel should look into getting more computers and get an additional area for internet access. In order to use the internet you must purchase a card. We bought a card for $8.00 granting us access for 1 hour. However a couple of times the system was down. At check out we still had 38 minutes on our card and they refunded us in full. Guests were also able to use their own laptops but they want you to pay them about $3.00 for 15 minutes.  The food wasn't as bad as mentioned in other reviews. It was just odd sitting down in Italian, Asian and International restaurants and all the chefs are Dominican.  Many items at the gift shop on grounds at the hotel were overpriced. The staff at the store were unprofessional and showed no character and very little class. The best shopping was done right outside of the hotel at a little mall. We gave our business to store #5. The more items purchased the better the discount. They love U.S. dollars.  Having a room in the Club building made it difficult at breakfast, lunch and dinner time. All of the dining was done at the main building and you had to catch a trolley/train between buildings. The train luckily did run every five minutes. The advantage of having a room in the Club building was the acces to the pools which had swim up bars. Drinking takes places from morning until night. Some of the more famous drinks were Coco Loco with rum, Lemonade with Vodka, Banana Mama with rum and Mamajuana(a mans drink).  I would definitely consider revisiting this resort.Mr.  Mrs. Bullock

<Author>DenP
<Content>Not all that Being a seasoned traveler I consider myself pretty openminded when it comes to foreign travel. I've done all kinds of accomdations from backpacking to all-inclusives. My preference is for the simple mom and pop lodging lodging where you're more likely to get interaction with the local people and their culture. But I was only going to be in Punta Cana for 4 days, so I would suck it up and do an all-inclusive. Grand Paradise Bavaro is OK, if OK is what you want. Below are the pros and cons:Pros:- A beautiful beach. You can literally see your feet in the water. It's was warm and relaxing at the same. - The staff is very warm. When considering the number of guests they deal with, they're doing the best they can. - Check-in/Check-out was relatively quick.- The drinks were strong. But I prefer them that way. - The hotel entertainment was incredibly cheesy, yet it was entertaining. Cons:- Timeshare salesmen. Hotels in other countrires keep these people out. Punta Cana hotels have made a deal where these guys can work inside the hotels. It's true a simple 'no thank you' will suffice and they leave you alone. And yes, this is a develeping country and these people are earning an honest living and probably not getting much in return. Yet, constantly getting accosted becomes annoying after a while. - The buffet was in a sauna of a building with hardly any windows. It's no fun to be drenched in sweat while eating. - How hotel information is communicated is extremely unorganized. We were not given any information on where all the activities were and had to figure it out on our own. - There are plenty of day excursions available. But there really is not an opportunity to walkaround a downtown area on your own and experience the local culture. Most people hop around from one resort to another. If I wanted to hang around other Americans/Canadians, I wold have stayed at home. Overrall, my experience in this hotel was positive. If all-inclusive is what you prefer, go to Mexico, Jamaica, or the Bahamas.

<Author>Lauren21
<Content>Two weeks in paradise!! My boyfriend and I stayed at the Grand Paradise Bavaro from April 14th to the 28th and absolutely loved it!! We booked through a travel agent and then through Air Canada vacations and everything was pretty much organised amazingly. We were on the ground floor in building number 6, after being moved from a room that had two double beds (we requested a king), which looked out onto the pool and was about a 3 minute walk to the beach. The ground floor can get a bit noisy though especially when people start to go to bed after the disco but we got used to it!! There were basically no major complaints, but as we had read some trip advisor reviews prior to leaving we knew what to expect. The dominicans are very friendly and helpful but do work on their own time and nothing will make them rush!! So just be open minded to the fact that even if there is a lineup at the bar they will still stop and clean the counters and floors and you will have to wait. There are alot of european people at the resort so they try to cater to everybody by saying everything in French, Spanish and then English-sometimes German as well, the food was the same there was a bit of everything for everybody. Lots of variety in the buffet as well-we actually preferred the buffet to the a la carte restaurants as there was so much available. We were at this resort for two weeks and didn't get sick of the food. We did really like the Seascape seafood restaurant the best out of the a la carte restaurants, but you need to book your a la carte restaurants as soon as you can as they book up. You will get 3 restaurant coupons per week when you check in. The variety of drinks are good as well and my boyfriend who is a beer drinker thought that the house beer was just fine. The rum fruity drinks are great as well!! For entertainment every night there is a show at 9.30pm and they were all good-the dancers are really energetic and they are always trying to get everyone involved in the fun. The animation team are in charge of the daily activities as well and try to get everyone involved in the daily events. There is lots to do. We also went on an excursion to Saona Island which was voted one of the top ten beaches in the world-our representative didn't mention that the bus ride to get to where the catamarans leave was about an hour and forty five minutes ride. Our guide for the tour was excellent and made it fun for everyone. The katamaran trip was about an hour and a half but was fun-the dominicans take total offense if you say no when they offer you rum!! The island was beautiful and a lunch and drinks are included and then they take you by speedboat to a natural pool where the caribbean and the atlantic ocean meet. This was the best part of the trip, the water was warm and crystal clear and so fabulous. I recommend this excursion to future travellers!!The beach at the resort was the reason we went and was awesome, the water was warm but still refreshing with white powdery sand. There was a few days when there was alot of seaweed in the water after a tropical storm but the water was mainly crystal clear and so nice to relax and swim in. You have to get up really early to get a good hut to sit under and you definitely need one as the sun gets pretty hot after about 10.30am. Everyone gets up early to reserve one which is wrong but you have to do it. I would definitely recommend this resort to other travellers-there were obviously some people that had negative things to say but when we went on our day trip the other travellers from the other resorts had worst things to say about theirs. Overall we had a fantastic time and would definitely go back again.

<Author>OlaOntario
<Content>Wonderful Holiday ! We traveled to The Grand Paradise Bavaro from March 21-28. This was a Wednesday to Wednesday stay, and everything went smoothly. The airports are not as busy midweek, and check-in at the resort took no time at all.The resort is beautiful, and very clean. We travelled with another couple and requested rooms close by, not a problem. The room (Bldg 1) was very clean, and had a nice balcony. We did not request ocean view, but if you cranked your head over the balcony, there was the ocean! Bonus. Ask for 2 room keys. You need a key to run the electricity (air conditioner etc). We left one key in the slot all the time and our room was always cool. There was always purified water and soft drinks in the fridge. We tipped the maid daily with little gifts (earrings,nail polish, and several US dollars), leave on the pillow. I would suggest you take a small digital clock radio especially if you want to know the time in the middle of the night.There are plenty of lounge chairs both on the beach and around the pools. However if you want a specific location, get up early and place towels on the chairs. We spent several days under the cabanas at the beach as well as days around the quiet pool...and it was quiet. The other pool and kids pool were more active if that's your style. We packed a couple of pool noodles and they sure came in handy if you want to float around the pool. They sold inflatable rafts in the gift shop, or you could bring your own if you wish.There are plenty of bars, and they are busy all the time,but service is fast. Take a couple of Keg type thermos. They are happy to fill them with beer or whatever. It stays cold longer, and you can drink it from the keg or pour into a glass. If you enjoy wine, it is available all day long. It is light and quite pallitable.Every night we went to the Piano Bar for drinks before dinner. You can get the regular all inclusive drinks here, and for an extra cost they also have international drinks such as Johnny Walker Scotches etc.No complaints about the food. The buffet restaurant always had lots of choices, and each night had a different theme. We booked 3 a la carte restaurants, Italian,Steak House, and the best was our dinner at The Club....a short trolly ride to the sister resort. All the a la carte meals were gourmet, and the service was excellent. A suggestion would be to book your a la cartes as soon as you arrive and get your room number, even if your room is not ready, ask for the number. The reservations girl is at the top of the grand staircase in the lobby. We also enjoyed the no smoking rules in most of the restaurants!We also took insulated coffee mugs, filled them at the buffet and enjoyed our coffee on the beach or around the pool. If you like peanut butter on your toast...bring your own from home.Spend at least one afternoon at The Club. You can take the trolley or walk. They have a wonderful swim-up bar there.We have no complaints about Grand Paradise Resort. The service was great, and the staff were very friendly. Just remember, this is a 24 hour all inclusive resort, and some people party well into the night. If you are not one of them, take ear plugs!PS Hats off to Nolitours, they did a great job and the rep was very helpful...especially when our flight time was changed for the trip home. Good communications!

The place was filled with Europeans!!!It was not a horrible stay, but it was definitely not what I had expected--we ran into many problems in our room--toilet broken, everything in the bathroom leaking--and the front desk was not very accomodating. <Author>Ponytailpaul
<Content>It really is pretty good Can I start by saying that by the time we were leaving the UK for this holiday we were really worried by many of the reviews on tripadvisor about this hotel. Do not worry ! Whether you like this hotel will depend a bit on what you usually book and expect. It is obvious that this is a large hotel operating on an all-inclusive basis so it will obviously not normally appeal to those who like a small intimate, quiet hotel/spa. For our holiday this hotel was booked by friends who had been before as they wanted to celebrate an anniversary and go with a group of friends and children for a week and we decided to go a week earlier and have two. Our friends said that they had been very happy with the hotel and it was a lot better than some other hotels they had stayed on on other caribbean islands,so it came recommended. While we were there there were people from Canada, France, Spain, Mexico and all over though I would say predominantly North American. In our first week we were the only English, but that was ok.We ourselves don`t honestly normally go to such big hotels so it was a bit of a shock on arrival when all things are strange. Well, we didn`t see a cockroach in two weeks, the room was spacious and clean, we found nearly all the staff pleasant and helpful, some very cheerful and very helpful, the food was good, the pools and gardens lovely, the beach and sea beautiful and we had a great time. The main restaurant is big ( it has to be ) but the food is varied and good and they have themed nights. When you book in ( assuming this applies to everybody ) you are given vouchers to use three times a week in the a`la carte restaurants. You have to book these in advance and it is best to try and decide as soon as possible for availability. There is a Chinese (we didn`t use so can`t comment), Italian ( good ), Grill ( good ) and Fish ( very nice ). There are four main bars, the Piano bar above reception, the poshest and nice in the evening with the best cocktails, the sports bar (computers, pool table, etc) and two beachside bars, one where all the action is ( aerobics/volleyball) and a quieter one by the grill and fish restaurants. The latter was our favourite for general use but the beach bars are very busy during the day and the staff can get a bit pressurised on occassion and you don`t always get a big smile. At the same time I noticed that most holidaymakers didn`t use please or thank you very much so that may be why. The cocktails in these bars don`t have fruit in and on a couple they use ready made mixes but you can have as much as you like, and most do. Big tip, take a thermos mug with you, you can get more in it and keep your drinks cool longer. Of course there is plenty of rum ! It also comes in handy in the morning to get some coffee to your room ( no facilities to make in room, so take a travel kettle if you want to ) or take a drink back at the end of the afternoon ( only soft drinks in fridge ).There is food and drink available twenty four hours in one form or another.This is very much a beach resort ( there is very little locally) with plenty of watersports and there are quite a few organised trips you can do. Like most hotels they say you cannot reserve sun loungers ( there are plenty ) but everybody does as usual especially if you want a sun shade. This review is getting longer and longer so I would just like to thank the concierge Juan  who was great and organised a lovely last evening party for us with the excellent fish restaurant staff.The only real negative, and this will not spoil your holiday but they should do something about it and many reviews say this  the staff in the shop don`t give a damn, but you are only buying a packet of pringles or something so it doesn`t matter that much in the great scheme of things. Just about all the staff were very friendly and helpfull, cleaners, gardeners and all. Finally, if this is the right kind of hotel for you then don`t worry, you will have a good time. This is a positive review
