<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>You Get What You pay For!! My 3 friends and I just returned from Grand Paradise Bavaro on Saturday, March 25, 2006. Prior to going to Punta Cana, we read the hotel reviews and had some reservations in staying at this hotel. However, I must say, that the hotel itself is beautiful. For the most part, our vacation was very relaxing and we all agree that we enjoyed the beautiful weather and the staff. Check in went smoothly with no problems. The desk clerk Junior was very professional and friendly. He checked us in within 20 minutes. Although our rooms were not ready when we arrived (we arrived early 2:00pm) by the time we ate lunch and returned to the front desk our room was ready and we received our key (ask for 2 keys, you will need one to control the air and electricity when you leave the room). Rooms - the room was adequate and clean. Nothing spectacular. There is a fridge stocked with a gallon of water and variety of soda. Rooms were cleaned and beds made with clean linen by 11:30am. We received 2 towels however we had to request two wash clothes everyday. Evidently they don't use Downy the wash clothes and towels were kind of rough but clean. I would suggest getting a key for the safe that is in your room ($20). Our room was in Bldg.6 which is basically in the middle of everything, the beach and the pool area. Great spot.! Pool and Beach - Beach is gorgeous w/a constant breeze. Beach towels were scarce. We had been told to return our towels each day and receive fresh ones however, that was not the case. We had to use the same towels for 3 days and had to complain before receiving clean ones. Pools were great and spacious. Activities were available poolside everyday including exercise classes, salsa lessons and other corny games. Evening entertainment consisted of a watered down version of Las Vegas shows and other silly little games and guest participation. The disco opened at 11pm. Never made the disco - by 11 I was sleep. There is also a game room available with pool, table hockey, ping pong, and a small area with approx.15 slot machines. A bar is also available as well. Was not impressed at all with the entertainment available. Let's talk about the food. Not impressive at all. You won't starve, but if you enjoy eating good food, this is not the place. The buffet was open seating for breakfast lunch and dinner but most times we had to wait for a table. If you want to eat at one of the International resturants, Italian, Asian, Seafood and Dominican resturants, I would suggest making reservations when you first arrive. They fill up fast!! Unfortunately, the food in these resturants were not that great either. I actually enjoyed the Asian food the best. La Grille which is located on the beach for lunch has great roasted chicken and french fries!! We filled up on chicken everyday. I found the bar drinks to be extremely sweet and watered down. However, the younger guest did not seem to mind it and had a great time just drinking!!! The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They work very hard and I am quite sure for very little pay. I agree with the traveler from Framingham, MA., the guest were the rudest people I have ever come in contact with. Obvious a lot of them never learned the word Excuse me. A woman almost knocked me over and never uttered a word of apology. Although this is all inclusive, we left $2 a day to the housekeeper and $4 to the waiter (it was 4 of us)and they were so appreciative and surprised. Guests do not tip.. but are very demanding when requesting more coffee, etc.This is a great place for family vacation w/children as well as young adults who are on a limited budget or traveling with a group of people. Personally, I would not return anytime soon. I felt confined and reluctant to leave the premises. Also there is a language barrier which makes it difficult to communicate. All in all, the trip was relaxing, the weather was fantastic!!! The accommodations were adequate and for the price--we got what we paid for....

<Author>FloridaAng3
<Content>Spend more money My husband and I just returned from Grand Paradise Bavaro last evening. I read all of the positive and negative reviews before we went and I guess I fall somewhere in the middle. On the whole we had a nice vacation but there are a few things which we didn't like.Transfers: Very friendly people. The ride is about 45 minutes but air conditioned. You see A LOT coming to the resort and it makes you very grateful to be living in the U.S.Check in: Went very smoothly. We were given a packet which was helpful. One key which you need to not only get in the room but also to work electricity and air. When you leave the room the air and the lights go with you. Our baggage was delivered promptly. Our check in was 4:30 so the room was ready.Room was not fancy but clean. Clean sheets every day and a fridge with large bottled water and soft drinks. Shampoo and soap and conditioner was provided and there is a hair dryer and ironing board and iron. We had a first floor garden view with a terrace and 2 chairs and a table. My husband and I enjoyed sitting outside every morning and evening. Ashtray provided if you smoke. My advice would be not to spend extra money on an ocean view room as you can stil see the ocean from just about every room. Our room was supposed to be in building 2 but we asked to be switched at check in to be near our friends and that was no problem. We ended up in building six which is close to everything.Food: Buffet breakfast has everything you could want. The coffee is delicious, warm milk i8s a nice touch. Scrambld eggs were watery but you could have an omelet made fresh or fried eggs made fresh. French bread was wonderful and fresh fruit every meal. The drawbacks here would be finding a table with everything you need on it. No fresh orange juice or mimosas here. But everything hot or cold you can think of for breakfast and maybe some things you didn't think of. Lunch was either buffet or out at the pool. They had OK pizza and fries, hamburgers and hot dogs, roasted chicken, fish, pasta, and ribs or pork daily outside which was good. Also fruit and salad. Buffet was hot and cold items and desserts and ice cream which I loved. Coffee flavor was the best. Not gourmet food but average. Dinner was a theme buffet so you should check to see what the theme is before you decide on restaurant or buffet. We could only at at 3 restaurants for the week. We chose Dominican which was very good and friendly workers. French International where they were not friendly. I tried to order a salad, a soup and escargots and the waiter made a scene because he said I could only have 2. Huh???? All inclusvie remember? Anyway I was not happy and the food wasn't very good. I didn't feel well all the next day and I just wonder what they did to my dinner. Third choice was seafood. I ordered Lobster. The menu said, grilled, garlic or termidor. He said they only had termidor. My husband ordered fillet and garlic lobster and he got his. So why only termidor? Again not the greatest. We were happy to go back to the buffet because even though some of the food wasn't to our liking, we could always find something to eat. In a nutshell, food is just average.Bar: Not good at all. Very little ice in the drinks. Domestic alcohol only and it isn't good. Pina Colada's are watery as are the other drinks. No frozen margarita's here. No frozen anything here. No blender here. House wine was from a box and no bottled beer. I'm not much of a drinker at all but I would have liked to have had one good frozen something. Bar is in need of a lot of work.Entertainment and activities: Dance lessons daily and aerobics. Nightly shows are boring. I really didn't want to see a guy from Switzerland in his underwear.Beach and Pool: Gorgeous. Both were wonderful. We never had problems getting towels. Topless beach but they were at the pool too. Not a problem for us but be prepared if you don't like that. Many vacationers are European so topless it is but not for me.Problems: No hot water for 2 days but it got fixed. Towels for the room. One hand towel which they reuse, 2 bath towels which they take but you have to wait for new ones, bath mat not changed daily and a wash cloth is not heard of. I left money for the maid daily and when I asked her for 4 bath towels she replied in Spanish 3. So no more tip. French restaurant was rude service. Bar servers also were rude at times. Very noisy at night. The halls just bellow when someone talks, argues in Spanish or is drunk at 4:00 A.M. Would I go back? No. I wouls spend more money and enjoy a finer resort. For what we paid I'd say we got our money's worth but I would rather spend more and get a little more.

<Content>Got back yesterday, still feeling the motion of the waves My husband and two children, age 9 and 11 just arrived yesterday from Grand Paradise Bavaro. After a very long day, (had two hour delay at airport due to freezing rain) this bus ride did not help....While waiting in line for checking in, we were greeted with a fruit drink(made sure there was no rum in it as they were offering to our kids too)....We paid a few dollars for someone to take our luggage to our room. We then went to the buffet(by then it was 9pm ).....I must admit the first time we saw that buffet, we said UH OH....but don't be scared by second day, you do get used to it and there are tons of choices....it is to be expected that in another country the food will be a little different. There are 5 a la carte restaurents that are all great. We went to two of them, the Cana Grill, we went twice, have the fillet mignon, it's to die for. and we went to the French cuisine restaurent, gorgeous atmosphere, great service and awsome food. I do agree to keep tipping, they work such long hours and they are soooooo nice most of them anyhow. The Beach: WOW....I swam in it for hours. we were nervous before leaving on how rough it would be for our kids, it was fine for our 9 and 11 year old. Keep an eye on the colour of the flag(where the boats are) the first day was red (go in at your own risk) and we were told to be very careful and we did not think it was that bad....we stayed at waste level during that time....then when it got to orange or green take a kayak out it's fun. My husband took both kids for a catamaran ride he had a blast. Please be aware, THERE IS FISH TO BE FOUND. TONS of them.....go to where the end of the swimming line is straight out from the beach...bring your own snorkels and masks and you will see TONS of fish, bring bread out and they will swarm around you.....beautiful blue , yellow and silver fish(did not see baracuda's but some did, smaller ones).....Another fun thing to do in the water is boogie boarding, we brought our own(inflatable) or you can borrow one from the resort. the kids had a blast with that. For those travelling with kids, Ana and Luz at the kids club are awsome. The nicest young women to look after your kids....Our kids only went a couple times during the day, my son wanted to play tennis. The kids show at night is pretty cute for them too at 8:30pm....my daughter was the oldest but she loved it. they danced and played games on stage,. one night at a disco  and another night at the beach. we met tons of great people from all over.We too brought an insulated jug that was a big tip that we picked up from others, the bubba keg(found at Walmart or CAnadian tire for $10.00) sometimes we had beer, most of the time water we even brought Gatorade crystals for a refreshing change and it really keeps the drinks cold out there in the heat. you do drink tons.....especially swimming in the salt water you will swallow that stuff.A tip on reserving the a la carte restaurents. We ended up having to do the line twice because we goofed the first time, did not have my papers that they give you upon check in. So when we went the second time we showed up 15 minutes early and sat with a drink and were one of the first to reserve(it starts at 10:30am)Everyone will have a different outlook of this place, go with an openend mind. We had a very good experience with Grand Paradise Bavaro, We WOULD go back. I hope this helps some....

<Content>A Great Value for Spring Breakers I went here with my girlfriend for Spring Break 06'. We were simply hoping to relax on the beach, have a few drinks, and enjoy ourselves. Nothing to it, oh, the wait to reserve can be long but please people, it's near the bar, grab a drink and be patient. Maids did a great job cleaning, I have no complaints. The staff was great, if you speak even a little Spanish you'll have it easier but most of them spoke a little English, so no problems.For the price, this place is great, I had an awesome spring break and would recommend it for college kids and couples especailly, can be a little loud probably for families. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>It was a great vacation, but probably wouldn't go back 8 of my friends and myself went to the Grand Paradise Bavaro for our Spring Break trip. I have never been out of the country, so I didn't know what to expect.AIRPORT: Pretty cute, straw roofs. Confusing when you first get in. They tell you you have to buy a $10 (US) Tourist Card to get through, then you hand it over 2 seconds later. I think it was just a scam for the country to make money, but I don't know. Not much security. TRANSPORTATION: Everyone is willing to help you, for a tip. We had reservations with Preito Tours, all in all it was fine. We tipped $2 per person and they seemed happy with that.As for the resort...FOOD: The food got a little...redundant. The buffet was weird the first night, they had goat! But we found stuff we liked, the pasta bar was a good thing to have so we could fall back on it. I loved the fresh fruit daily! The La Cana Grille is open for everyone for lunch, but they only had roasted chicken, white rice, french fries, pizza, and some salad. By the 4th day I couldn't stand the smell of it. We liked the buffet for breakfast, the omlettes were good! And I usually had toast and water (all the water at all of the restaurants and bars is bottled so you CAN drink it, as well as all the ice). We had a reservation for the Chinese restaurant and the Italian one as well. I was sick for the Chinese one but my friends said it was excellent. The Italian one was just OK. BARS: I didn't drink as much as I thought I would. All the soda was too sweet when it came out of the fountain so rum and cokes were way too sweet. The Banana Mama's were good, but I asked for less rum because they put a ton in it. The beer's actually pretty good. There were 3 bars, one in the buffet, one in the Sportsbar, one on the beach. Hey Buddy at the beach is the best! I never found any other drink I liked too much so I stuck with water most of the trip.POOL: The pool was awesome. There were actually 2 pools, right next to each other, and a couple jacuzzi's. I loved the pools. It was kind of hard to get 9 chairs all together but we managed. People aren't supposed to reserve the chairs, but everyone does anyways.BEACH: I know this sounds stupid but the sand got really annoying. It was EVERYWHERE, and it seemed to be really sticky. I'm sure I'll find sand on me for weeks to come! But the beach was gorgeous. Kind of small, but I think you're allowed to go on to other resorts beaches. The water is beautiful. So blue! And warm!! The undertoe is very strong so be careful. The water sports window has snorkling gear, boogie boards, kyaks, and other stuff they lend out. We always found chairs, just maybe not under one of the shady things.ROOMS: Our room was great. Besides being brought to the wrong room at first, the toilet getting clogged, our shower not working, and the AC not being very cold, it was fine. (HAHA, that sounds horrible). But they fixed the shower right away, and they gave us another key card to keep in the room to keep the AC on at all times. (You only get one key card, and if you want electricity when you're in the room you have to put it in the wall to turn it on...kind of weird). And they fixed the toilet right away too. The maid was great, we tipped her $2 a day and $5 at the end. Our room was always clean by 11 or so with plenty of towels and toilet paper. It was great! Kind of loud at night but, what can you expect? We also had good TV stations which not everyone in our group had. If you want a remote, it's a $20 deposit (we never got one) and a key to the safe is also $20 (we didn't get that either). There's a mini bar which had bottles of Coke, Sprite, Diet Coke, and a gallon of water. We brought our own waters (which I would suggest because I drank about 15 that week). We brought the small Poland Springs bottles and they fit great in the fridge.EXCURSIONS: We booked 2 excursions through Prieto Tours, upstairs in the main building of the resort. They had a list of them to choose from. We did the speed boats and snorkling (all in one type deal) and the ATVs and it came to $120 per couple. It was kind of expensive but there's really not much to do there so we figured it was worth it. Both were great. We loved snorkling. One of the pros was named Hector and he took my water camera and took some great pictures (I would suggest buying a couple water camera's at Walmart for $8 each instead of one at the resort for $28). That was a lot of fun. We tipped Hector $5 and bought the picture they took of us. I could have done without the speedboats but whatever. I loved the ATV one too. They took us to a sort of ranch and showed us Cocoa, Coffee, Grapefruits, and other stuff. It was great. We bought a small container of coffee from the owner for $4. He was thrilled. The grapefruit was excellent, and the coffee was very good too!! We went to the beach, too, and then through the mud so bring some crappy pants and shoes!! And try and not bring a bag, mine's kind of ruined now. But it was alot of fun!! We tipped the leader person $5 because we liked it so much.We then went horseback riding and I didn't like it too much. I've never ridden a horse and my sneakers were soaked from the ATVs so I wore flip flops and my ankles killed!! And my butt and thighs. My horse ran alot, I didn't like that. And when we got to the beach to go swimming it was too cold. I could have done without the horseback riding but it was a good experience. The guys were helpful too and stayed with me because I didn't like to go fast!!The airport home was insane. When we got off of the bus these people RAN to our bags to take them to where we had to go and then expected a tip and we were out of money so we couldn't tip them. They didn't seem to happy. We waited in line to check in for like 25 minutes, and then they picked one of the people in our group to go through her bag. Then they printed 2 tickets for one person and no tickets for another. Luckily we got into the U.S. ok. There were lines everywhere and we didn't really know where we were going. At that point I just wanted to go home!I had a LOT of fun on our vacation, but I don't think I would go back. The resorts were very secluded because there's nothing to do outside the resorts. The shows at the resort were good. I wouldn't recommend getting traveler's checks because they're a pain in the --- to deal with. There's a few shops right off the resort called Punta Blanca, artists and coffee and jewelry. We went 3 times, haggling is pretty good. My friend got the guy down from $60 to $20 for a painting. You can use American money there so don't bother exchanging it.It was a great trip but I'm glad to be home!!! Feel free to email with any questions.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Straight Scoop on Grand Paradise Just returned yesterday (3-09-06) from Grand Paradise. Like many others, after reading negative reviews, my wife and I were a little worried about our stay. Our worries were totally unfounded. Here's our opionion: We are just your average middle-class travelers. First time to D.R., so we have no other experiance to compare, but we had a wonderful stay at Grand Paradise.Everything from flights to transfers to accomodations went smoothly.Punta Canta Airport- Most people we dealt with spoke enough english to understand quite well. They directed the crowd toward the proper areas. You must buy a $10.00 visitor permit on your way through. It was easy to find our shuttle to the hotel, they tracked us down. Hold on if you're expecting a smooth ride to the hotel. It definitly is not the U.S.  Quite an eye opener. The Hotel- We were greeted and registered in less than 10 minutes, and our luggage was delivered to our room. Room was nice, clean and large, with an ocean view. We were in building 5, just steps to the beach and the pool bar.The staff- Hard working and friendly. Please tip these people well. They work long, hard days. Always pleasant. We tipped the maid $3.00 a day. My wife brought along some simple gifts for her, and left them each day. We had terrific service. We tipped a couple dollars everywhere we went. Bartenders were like family by the end of the week. The best advice we got before we left was to take along a couple of insulated travel mugs. We used them everywhere. Coffee in the morning, and all day long for drinks on the beach. Keeps the drinks cold for a long time in the hot sun.The Food - We loved it. We never did eat in the a la carte restaurants. We chose the buffet every night. There was something new to try every night. It's true that it was a little repetative after a couple of nights, but if you used common sense, and didn't stuff yourself every night with everything you possible could eat, it is a great experiance. The staff greats you with song and dance when the doors open at 6:30, and it is sincere. Your can see the pride in thier faces. We ate at the beach grill every day for lunch. Again we found something new to try every day. No complaints. As for the water, every negative review I have read is incorrect. We were told by our tour guide that all the water served in the restaurants, at the bar, and used in ice cubes is filtered water. The tap water is what you need to avoid. It is not suitable to drink anywhere in the D.R. We drank water with every meal and had no issues at all. The maids always made sure we had a good supply of bottled water in our room.The Beach - World class beautiful. The water is clear and blue. Tried snorkeling at our hotel beach. A little rough and not much to see. I'm sure there are much better places to snorkel if you go on an excursion. If topless women bother you, don't go to the beach. My wife loved the freedom of walking around topless, and we are from the northeast where it's a definite no no. It's a great novelty for the men as well, to see so many bare breasts, but it wears off after a couple days, your don't really think about it. Even saw at least one totally nude woman sunbather, so beware if it bothers you.Excursions - We spent a day on the Jeep Safari. If you want to see the real world of the D.R., I would recommend it. You drive all over the island, and see how the native people really live and work. Make sure you can drive a standard transmission if you book the trip. It was an all day trip. Actually, it could have been a couple hours shorter, toward the end, we were tired of dodging potholes and other drivers. It really, really gives you a sense of how fortunate we are in the U.S. Many of the people are extremly poor. We took a whole bag of wrapped gifts to hand out to the children in the towns as we drove through. We would have brought much more with us if we had known how much the kids loved getting things. Passing through the small villages, children would run out to the side of the road and shout Adio as we passed by, and had smiles on thier faces. Quite an experiance.If you want more information about this hotel, please email me, I would be more than happy to respond.

<Author>Tomji
<Content>Mediocre, at Best I don't have much to add because I WHOLLY and ENTIRELY agree with a number of the previous reviews. Refer to March 4, 2006 (Not Bad, but not the Best in Punta Cana), February 26, 2006 (Dont go - substandard resort)and February 21, 2006 (Just O.K.). Yes, the price to go there is cheaper than the rest of the resorts in Punta Cana but there is a reason why! I agree that this resort may be the biggest bang for your buck, but that depends on what you're interested in. This may be a good option for young families or budget minded travellers. I would never go to this place for a romantic get away with my fiance.Anyways, if any of the below bother you and are dealbreakers(as they were for me) - shell out the extra bucks and have yourself a fabulous vacation without second guessing yourself as to why you ever chose to go to the Grand Palace. I have my eye on the Secrets Excellence next time around!Things that Bothered Me:- You will not go hungry at the buffet. The food isn't good but it's not bad either. One thing that bothered me was that there were a number of buffet items that were clearly popular with the masses because the tray would empty quickly. What was frustrating is that at times, there were multiple empty trays at the buffet because the buffet dishes were not being restocked on a timely basis. I'm not talking about a few minutes, but significantly longer. And if you waited too long, the fruit trays were picked over and were left empty! Seriously, all the fruit was gone! I found this to be inadequate.- The wait staff were poorly organized: one employee was in charge of filling glasses with water, one employee was charged with setting tables, one employee was in charge of fetching coffee. They wandered randomly about carrying out their duties and it wasn't unusual to be overlooked and sitting at an empty table for 5-10 minutes without utensils or without a glass of water.- The tableware was dirty. Glasses routinely had stuff on them.- There were tableware shortages throughout the week. One morning, there were no coffee cups or glasses to be found. These shortages extended to the rest of the hotel as well. For example, one day the Towel Place asked me to return after 1PM because the ran out of towels. Furthermore, the housekeeping staff would take the towels when they cleaned the room only to return them in the late afternoon. They needed to do this because they didn't have enough towels at the time they cleaned the rooms.- Even though we tipped the housekeeping staff, they weren't very good at cleaning the room on a timely basis. For the majority of the week, our room was cleaned at about 4PM (and they still took the towels!) even though we asked Reception to speed up the process (very nicely, with please's and thank you's). The two times that the room was cleaned in the morning - we were so surprised, my mother and I's jaws dropped.- The rooms are conducive to carrying noise. It's true that as soon as someone is doing something as innocuous as walking down the hall, you will hear it. The problem is amplified the moment that people are making conversational noise or coming home smashed from the disco. Granted, I know this is a resort and people are supposed to have fun - but I've been to other resorts and this is honestly the worst it's been.- The lighting throughout the whole hotel is dark. I can get past this, as 85% of the locals don't even have electricity. The lighting is very dim in the rooms and in the restaurant, and I didn't enjoy it - but took it with a grain of salt. However, this may be disconcerting for others!Anyways, Caveat Emptor!PS - I never got sick. I think drinking the water at the resort is fine, as long as you don't drink the tap water.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not bad .... but not the best in Punta Cana Spent the week of Feb. 23 to March 2nd at the Grand Paradise Hotel. There were eighteen of us travelling. All and all we did have a good time. This was my 7th visit to Punta Cana. I had previously stayed at Riu Melao, Grand Bahia Principe, Princess Punta Cana, Bavaro Princess, Flamingo and the Beach Barcelo Bavaro. Of those 7 hotels, there are only two I would not go back to and the Grand Paradise is one of them, the other being the Flamingo where the service was horrible.Hereafter are the things I enjoyed at the Grand Paradise:- Entertainment/atmosphere: lots of entertainment planned in the evenings and things to do during the day.- Restaurants: (once you got past the wait - which is the worst I have experienced down south - nice variety of restaurants and the food was good.- Breakfast buffet: good selection.- Hotel size: somewhat small for Punta Cana making everything close by, which was nice for a change.- Beach: the beach in Punta Cana is hard to beat. Nice white sand and blue water. It was not a problem to get beach chairs. We had to get up early to reserve a palapa for shaded areas - but his is common to all hotels. This hotels does have a good number of palapas.- Costs: this was one of the lowest prices I have paid for a trip in Punta Cana.Now on to the things I did not enjoy so much:- room lighting: so low it is very difficult to see or pack at night.- cleanliness: the room was cleaned very quickly and not thoroughly, dishes were not very clean- dishes: other than the fact that it was not thoroughly washed, the hotel often ran out of clean dishes, especially cereal bowls in the morning where we often had to wait 30-45 minutes to get a bowl...- dinner buffet: food was just OK and given that the lighthing in the buffet area was very low, you often had to guess what was in the food.- hotel location: this hotel is located in a more secluded area of the beach than some of the other hotels I stayed at and I prefer a more central location.- drinks: this is the only hotel in Punta Cana that offered a limited selection of drinks. I could not even get a Caipirina... which was quite a disappointment for me.This pretty much covers it. So all in all, we had a good time but I will choose another hotel next time.

<Author>ksnavalon
<Content>Go with an Open Mind and Have Fun.......Great Value Vacation! I have to tell you, after reading SO many negative about this resort...I was truly worried. My boyfriend and I are both in our late 30's and have traveled quite extensively (Bermuda, Bahamas, Jamaica, Antiqua, St. Lucia, Puerto Rico, Costa Rica)---you get the idea. We had very low expecations when we left NJ for our vacation.We did not have transportation arranged from the airport to the Grand Paradise...but easily grabbed a taxi ($30 US) and beat the crowd out of the airport. It was approximately a 30 minute ride to the resort and we arrived at the check-in counter and were immediately accomodated. We tried to upgrade our room with a nice tip...but no ocean rooms were available and he refused the tip. No big deal...we only needed our room to shower and sleep! The room was a decent size...yes, it was a bit dark as I've read in reviews but the sink area in the bath area was well lit and all you needed. The room key activates the air conditioning and lights which I found to be a fantastic idea as far as conserving electricity. (I've read complaints about that too and can't figure out what the big deal is.)We tipped our maid a few dollars every day and were lavished with extra towels...extra water...extra diet coke. It was all we needed. My first impression of the pool/pool bar area was not great. Tons of fat guys in bikinis...beautiful girls and a big line at the bar. However, after landing a few drinks (we ordered 4 beers at a time)...we started to relax. The guests were all having a wonderful time...and I stopped judging everyone around me. We were all there for the same reason....to have fun! We tipped the bartender on every round...just $1...and let me tell you....we were treated like ROYALTY. The bartenders knew who we were...and we never waited for anything.The food was MORE than adaquate. Again..had very low expectations and was nicely surprised. I'm not a big buffet person...but for breakfast...I quite enjoyed it. Tons of fruit, fantastic bread, cheese, meats and just about anything you could possible think of. Lunch buffet at La Cana was also enjoyable...I stuck with pizza and french fries...but there were many other choices (ie grilled chicken, fish)...La Cana overlooks the ocean and the palm trees.....You seat yourself and help yourself and waiters are happy to serve you cocktails...the beach bar is just steps away. As far as dinner...we ate twice at the Asian restaurant and once at the Italian. We ordered the same food both times in the Asian place because we liked it...and really enjoyed the appetizers in the Italian restaurant...(fresh bread, procuitto, mozzarella  tomatoes, olives, grilled eggplant)...we ate so much that I actually wished I hadn't ordered dinner. My entree was not great and I was relieved not to eat it as I was stuffed!!! :)Making reservations for dinner is a bit of a pain...I stood in line for about an hour...HOWEVER, the line is formed by the beach bar...so grab yourself a few drinks..talk to people in line..and make the best of it. DO make all of your reservations at once so that you don't have to do it again. It really wasn't a big deal.The beach was the nicest I have EVER seen....(and I live on one!!!!!!) The sand was white and had the consistency of powdered sugar...the water was so many colors of blue..clear and clean...it was simply gorgeous. The workers at the resort rake any seaweed that has accumulated on the sand...and pick up all trash from the guests...It was beautifully kept and stretched on and on...you could walk forever. The beach was five star*****!!!!!! Plenty of chairs and palapas...my only suggestion is that if you need shade...take your towels down in the morning and reserve yourself a few chairs. Reserve in front of the beach bar...as it is quieter AND...the beach bar is unused during the day....no waiting (and remember...if you tip...you won't wait anyways.) We spent the entire day on the beach...and virtually no time at the pool.The beer was great...the vino blanc was ok...the rum and diet cokes were killer...best pina coladas and not so great margaritas...no reason to complain. If you order a drink and don't like it...DON'T complain...and don't drink it. TRY something else. You can make this trip what you want it to be. You are in a third world country and should EXPECT things to be different.You are getting a bargain at this place. Yes, the resort itself is more like a Holiday Inn (you aren't paying for the Ritz Carlton)...it is a value vacation and it is one worth taking. I am planning on taking my children to this resort in the fall. PS...we didn't get sick....and we ate, and drank a lot! Take Immodium just in case and be prepared.PSS....to those of you who LOVE to complain, my advice is, don't go...stay home...and be miserable. PSS....TIP TIP TIP. They don't expect it...and every $1 we handed over was SO VERY appreciated. Not like here in the states where everyone just EXPECTS to be handed money. These people work hard and deserve to be treated well by the visitors to their country. If you have any questions...feel free to email me at ksnavalon@yahoo.com! :) :) :)

<Content>Moderate but nothing special We go away every year and had heard that the beaches in Punta Cana are fantastic. On that there is no dispute, they were the most beautiful we have seen. We stayed at the Grand Paradise and although it is quite true that it is very clean, we found that overall we were quite disappointed. The food, for the most part, bordered on being absolutely terrible, although we did have one fantastic meal in the International al a carte restaurant. The people were warm and wonderful but the service was very basic. Probably because most people don't leave even a minimal tip at the end of their meal, which would certainly discourage me. I would rate this as a 3.5 star hotel, not the 4.5 we thought we were paying for.

<Content>OK for most but not for me My wife and I stayed from Dec 25th till Jan 4th. Before I write about the GPB let me explain a few things. My family goes every year and has for the last 8 years. This was my wife and I first vist.We NEVER go to places where jets can land, have golfcourses or casinos. Typically when we go away it isto small islands where the population is less thana few hundred. I mention the above because I knewit was going to be difficult to adjust to the noise, etc but anyway here is my review.The staff is fantastic. Shame on any of you thathave complained about lack of service. Yes it maybe slow at times but the staff always smiles andmost put in 15 hour days. OUr electricity went outfor an hour one day and it took about 2 hours to getcorrected. Big deal, you are in the islands to relax.The food was ok considering. I am a VERY, VERY pickyeater. If you go to the buffets only eat the foodthat looks appetizing. In other words if yourfavorite dish is one of the meals but it doesn'tlook good dont eat it.TIP..everyday from noon till 5 pm the La Cana grillhas fresh baked chicken. There are fries salad and usually a fish and pork dish. We ate the chicken everyday. Yes everyday. We skipped the buffet.If you want to eat in one of the ala carte restaurantsreservations are required. The reservationist sits next to the LaCana grill starting at 10:30 I believe.Typically there are long lines. You can avoid thishassle by going to  The Club  portion of the resort a short tram ride and and she is there at 8:30am. Skip the Chinese restaurant unless you are from some backwater in the midwest. No offense to midwesterners etc but if you are from the boonies in North Dakota it will probably seem fine. Long pants are required. We never ate at the Italian Restaurant. La Cana Grill and the Seafoodrestaurant were ok, nothing more. Some portions of some meals were very good, others sucked.We stayed in room 3128,our family had that wholeside of the building, lower floor. Our room was the nicest as it was on the end. We left 2 dollars every day for Candida our housekeeper. We asked for an extragallon of bottled water each day and got it, butnot because we tipped. Regarding tipping, come on folks...loosen up. We gave our regular servers 10.00each per week and occaisonally 2 dollars here and there. Many people staying never give anything. THeworkers put in incredibly long days and do so with a smile. A buck here and there won't make or break you.The beach is beautiful, but can be crowded. We are early risers and would lay our towels under the beach palapa each morning at about 7 am just before we had our coffee and fruit and the buffet. If you try and get one after 10 or 10:30 you may have a problem.Unfortuantely a helicoper flys by about every 20 minutes from some sightseeing tour.The roomlights are dim so if you want to read at night bring a book light.There is hi speed computer access for 10.00 per  hour.. The three unitsare located in the game room which is quite noisy ifyou need to work.I never went to the night clubs or shows so can't comment. Most of the people I spoke to were quitesatisfied with the hotel and food. Don't forgetto brush your teeth with the bottled water.Cab from the airport is typically 30 bucks, I gavea 5 dollar tip.For fun you may want to take a cab to a restaurantcalled Capitan Cooks in El Cerrito, a 15 minute15 dollar cab ride. Its on the beach and has greatlobster and fresh caught fish. If you want to splurgethey have a platter for 100.00 that includes allyour drinks, dessert etc. The platter includes 3 or4lobsters ( 1 big, 3 small) shrimp, fish, musselsetc. Too much food for two folks! Anyway if youare looking for an inexpensive beach vacation this might be the place for you. Have fun

This is by sure the poorest hotel vacation choice we had ever made. The prior visits to the Allegro and Occidental resorts in Punta Cana were far better. A quick guideRum Anniversary - $14Paintings - $10-30Braclets $4-5Statues $15Take their first price and cut in 1/2. Walk away. <Author>Honkindude
<Content>I'd give it a solid 4* I thought I'd throw in a quick review as we always research this site before going away and I thought I should add my 2 cents as well ... We just got back ..Travelled there with two children aged 8  10 December 8 - 15. This was our first trip to the caribbean with our two kids. My wife and I had been to Dominican  Cuba by ourselves before but we were a little nervous bringing the kids this time.These would be my ratings:Resort - 4. Very well kept. A great resort for kids  families as it's on the smaller side compared with other resorts in Punta Cana. Everything is within a short walking distance. There is a sister resort next door called the Club. You take a 5 minute trolley ride to get there. My wife and I went and explored it the one day. It is much quieter. The have a nice pool but no beach. People staying at this section have to come to the main resort for the beach.I think everyone there was french. Even the animation staff were only speaking french. We ate at the their restaurant one evening as it is an alacarte. It was very nice and the food was very good. A nice change from the buffet.The Beach - 5+. The beach is gorgeous. Never had a problem getting a lounger as we have in other resorts. Be careful of the waves as the water can be very rough. there is a strong undertow so I would not let small children venture out too far. My kids had a blast boogie boarding. The room - 3+. The room was comfortable. Nothing fancy but was very clean. We had two double beds that were very comfortable for us and the kids. The bathroom could have used some minor tweaking and the water pressure wasn't the greatest. The maids did a great job of keeping everything tidy. Give the Maid a buck everyday and don't be cheap .. this is nothing for us and they really appreciate it. Mini bar stocked with Coke, Sprite and water but no beer unfortunately. This was not a big deal as the bar was only a minute's walk away.The Food - 3. The food was a little disappointing. Usual Buffet stuff. Nothing fancy. Usual omelette station in the morning. Not a big selection of fresh fruit. We ate lunch at the beach bar every day. The pizza and the roasted chicken was delicious .. better than Swiss Chalet. The kids stuck to the chicken, Pizza and french fries everyday. The food was very repetative however. Try to eat at a few of the alacartes as it breaks up a week of the buffet.The Kids Club 5+. The staff at the kids club were fantastic. Ana, Micky, and Lucy did a great job keeping the kids entertained. There were generally 8-10 kids there everyday. It was great as some of the kids spoke different languages but they all seemed to get along together wonderfully. I must admit we were a little leary leaving the kids by themselves but rest assured all three girls do a wonderful job at supervising the kids. You can leave them there for as long or as little as you want. We generally left them for an hour in the morning and an hour in the afternoon. This was a family vacation so we wanted to spend a lot of time with our kids. I think some families took advantage and left their kids there everyday for the entire day.They had games and contests for the kids to participate in and they had a little mini-disco every evening at the main stage. The kids had a blast. Overall I would rate the entire resort as a 4*. Not a 4+ as sunquest does. Lots of people form all over the world. I would say that we (english speaking) were in the minority at this resort. A lot of European and spanish speaking tourists at this resort. Even people from other parts of the Dominican were here on holiday.A lot of people we spoke with at the airport on our journey home had rave reviews of the Gran Bahia Principe which is just a short walk down the beach from the Grand Paradise. We might try that next. We had a great holiday but would probably not go back to the Grand paradise but would definitely return to a Bavaro Beach resort.Hope this review helps.

<Content>A wonderful place for our 5 yr Anniversary! We were at the Grand Paradise the week of Oct. 9, 2005. My husband and I went there to celebrate our 5 year annivesary and had a wonderful time!When we arrived, we were able to find our shuttle and arrived at the hotel quickly. We were greeted warmly by Claribel at the front desk and allowed to check in early (11:00am) which was nice. Claribel was very pleasant and also spoke very good English, which helped us out considerably. She gave us a wonderful room in Bldg. 6 on the 3rd floor. We had a view of the beach and the pools - we couldn't have asked for a better spot. I have to admit, we had some reservations about how things were going to go from some of the reviews we had read, but Claribel set the tone for our entire vacation and everything went very well.The room was clean and comfortable. The maid did a good job of keeping it stocked and cleaned. We did have to ask for washcloths and handcloths each day, but always received them promptly. I don't think those are standard for the people in the DR, but it is what we are used to and the accomodated us nicely.We had no problems getting reservations at the restaurants. We were actually able to make all of ours at the same time. It would have been nice to have more than 3 nights for these rest., but we managed with the buffet just fine the rest of the time. We were not a big fan of breakfast, as we are just used to cereal and donuts, but found that the egg station was quite good. Things did start to all taste the same by the end of the week, but we had no problems with the food. We did not get sick, as others had stated they had. We had no problem getting a cabana when we wanted or chairs by the pool. There was always plently of space. This was not their busy time of year, so I'm sure that helped.It did rain a little every day, but it was so humid, that was to be expected. We didn't let it ruin our fun!We took part in the shows and activities that they had at the resort and had a great time. We were called up on stage for almost every show we went to and learned to dance, among other things. We also took an excursion with Bavaro Runners (Mimi was our guide). It was a great way to see the DR countryside and we had lots of fun. You could drink all the Rum you wanted and lunch was included with the price. My husband and I are not big drinkers, but we had a good time on this excursion. We had booked the excursion with Jose, one of the reps at the hotel, and he was also very kind to us. He even took us into downtown one afternoon so we could go shopping and then picked us back up and brought us back to the hotel. He was a riot!!! Overall, we had a wonderful time. We are glad we picked Punta Cana as a place to spend our 5 year anniversary, as we will surely remember it. I believe your experience is only as good as you believe it is going to be. We went with a positive attitude and treated everyone very nicely and they did the same back to us. I would recommed this hotel to other travelers with no problem. If you go, just keep smiling and have fun!!

<Author>Fjr1300Rider
<Content>Fantastic Week at the Grand Paradise Bavaro My family and I vacationed at the GPB from August 21st to the 28th and everyone had a wonderful time. We have a 12 year old boy and a 9 year old girl. We stayed at the Club section of the resort, which is about a 10 minute walk, or 5 minute tram ride to the main resort and enjoyed its peacefulness after a busy day at the main resort. We had a first floor room (3171) which overlooked the pool and was quiet at night. The room was kept very clean, although being in the subtropics there were some bugs - mostly ants and millipedes. I reported the ants to the front desk and they sent someone to spay them. A word of caution though - the last morning as I was getting ready to shower there was a scorpion in the tub! I'm not sure how it got there, but make sure you keep your suitcases closed and shake out towels, check shoes, etc. prior to using and leaving!The grounds of the resort were immaculately kept. There were always staff cleaning and grooming. The pools were very nice, generally clean with a few insects floating. In my opinion the pools could have been skimmed more regularly, but that's a minor issue. The resort itself is very colorful. The buildings are painted different vibrant colors which add to the beauty of the place.The beach is absolutely stunning! The waves break right at the beach, so be careful if you have small children. Past the waves you can swim and snorkel. There are plenty of covered beach chairs, if you arrive at the right time. By midmorning they are generally all taken, but if you arrive early, or in the late afternoon you shouldn't have a problem finding a shaded spot.We ate most meals at the La Laguna buffet, mostly for its convenience and variety of foods. All of us enjoyed the food for all the meals and no one had any bad experiences with any of the foods. For use flies were a non-issue. Yes there were a few since the front door was constantly being opened, but nothing like some of the reviews made it sound. The food itself was plentiful, varied and generally very good - not 5 star - but tasty enough to enjoy. Each night was a different theme. We loved the abundance of fresh fruit to choose from - the mangos were absolutely delicious!We also ate dinner at the Manglar, which is at the club, and the Asia restaurants. The Manglar was very good and the Asia was acceptable.We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful the entire stay. We tipped the maid $2 every day and tipped $1 or $2 at some dinners if one particular person stood out service wise.Entertainment and activities are run by the animation team. If you like to stay active then there is plenty to do throughout the day. Activities are geared toward the younger adults, but anyone can join in. The nightly entertainment is terrific! I'm amazed at how much energy the animation team has. Shows start at 9:45pm and before the shows they have different preshows to entertain as well.We did three different trips while staying. First we did the 2 hour snorkeling trip from the marina. This was a lot of fun. The boat ride gave a great view of the coast and resorts, but hold on it's a bumpy ride! We also went to Manati Park. This is a small park with shows. It was a fun way to spend an afternoon. The day before we left we did the Jurassic Safari. This is an all day trip and was a lot of fun. Part of the day involved driving in the mountains, which I especially enjoyed since the scenery was spectacular. We were also going to do the Catalina Island trip but it was cancelled due to weather related to Hurricane Katrina.The weather all week was beautiful. We only experienced a couple of very brief showers - the rest of the time it was sunny with scattered clouds.You will receive bottled water in your room - be sure to use it for brushing, etc. I made the mistake of rinsing my mouth out with sink water on the third day and paid for it with a bout of diarrhea that evening. Thankfully the Imodium I brought did the trick and I was fine the rest of the week.Also the resort lost its cold water on Tuesday and hot water on Wednesday. We received apology letters under our door offering a lobster dinner for the inconvenience. For us this was just a minor inconvenience. The staff was very good in bringing us extra water for flushing the toilet.To wrap things up, we had a great time and would definitely return to the GPB for a future trip.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very Fun And Lively Hotel This resort was a lot of fun. We just returned from a five night visit. I read all the negative reviews before we left and was a bit worried but promised to be positive and go in with a good attitude. I am not hard to please but my husband and kids can be at times. We arrived early Friday morning. Check in was easy. I slipped the reception Clerk a $20.00 bill and asked for two good rooms. We received an ocean view suite with a large bath that overlooks the ocean--- beautiful view(I recommend doing this). The kids stayed two doors down, a little jealous of our room but they visited often. NEGATIVES: The rooms are lacking a little in creature comforts. The TV is small (but who is there to watch TV anyway..) No alarm clock and yes a lack of wash cloths. We had two small shampoo/conditioner bottles for the first four days and on the fifth day three were added. No big deal because the first two lasted fine. The first night the power went out in the middle of the night leaving us without air conditioning for about 3 to 4 hours around 2 AM- 5 AM. My husband and I were sticking to the sheets and the heat woke us up. Luckily we had two balconies and opened both sliding doors to get a nice ocean breeze. My kids said they never woke up from the heat. This only happened on one nightPOSITIVES: BEATUTIFUL BEACH!!! Friendly staff. Nice pool. Excellent food. We found so much to do without having to leave the resort, although we did go on a snorkeling trip (I recommend) and a 2 hr horse back ride ($35.00 per person) Both were excellent. We saw beautiful tropical fish, a large ship wreck, nurse sharks in a cage and a view of the coast that was outstanding. The resort photographer took photos during the whole snorkeling trip and we bought the disc with about 40 photos on it for $20.00 They are beautiful photos of us and the fish. Also ladies take the opportunity to sun bathe topless without everyone staring at you. It was very liberating to sunbathe and swim topless like many of the European women there. I took advantage of this when my kids were still sleeping and found it refreshing. One woman did the morning exercise by the pool in her bikini bottoms- no one else but a few Americans batted an eye- my husband and 17 yr old son enjoyed it.The horse back ride showed us where the local Domenicans swim. This part of the beach is full of trash so don't expect resort views, but it gave us a flavor of the real life in Punta Cana. We bought a hat made of palm fronds from a teenager and handed out tootsie rolls and one dollar bills to the poor children. Be prepared to see families living in poverty. The children will beg for money. They ran alongside our horses. I didn't expect to see so many children and only had about fifteen dollar bills on me at the time. So I ran out of money with more children begging along the route. The homes are little shacks about the size of two back yard sheds. It broke our hearts to see how they lived . But it also made us thankful for what we have. I though it was important for my teens to see. Our horse guides were super sweet- Domingo and Enrique and they were very informative and helpful. I found communicating with them easy. We learned from each other. They were delighted with a five dollar tip at the end of the trip. A super nice lady from Queens, NY filled me in on what the workers earn. Her Aunts, Uncles, and cousins live there. She said hotel workers make the equivalent of $100.00 US dollars every two weeks. I noticed that they put in long days 12- 16 hour days. A Belgian man said the construction workers make $4.00 a day if they produce. And only $2.00 a day if they do not.After this information I tipped every worker $1.00 for any type of small service. They were all gracious. I gave some five dollars at the end of the week if they were especially helpful. I took about $100.00 worth of one dollar bills with us.Amauris, Luis and Ms Nancy were great on the Animation Team. They wear the orange shirts and keep things lively around the pool and at the shows. We saw the show in the theatre every night at 9:45PM and loved every one. These are talented people who work very hard-yet they seem genuinely happy. None of us got sick on food or water and we sampled everything between the five us since we all have different tastes.I found that what I remembered from my high school Spanish classes got us by. I could have cared less if anyone spoke English. It was nice to not understand others conversations-Everyone spoke the same language on the dance floor, the volleyball court, and the pool. I communicated through gestures sometimes and the Canadians German, and Spanish laughed and undertstood me.  So go eat, drink, swim, relax and enjoy hearing the different languages, and eating different food. Isn't that why we go to somewhere different from the comforts of home. If you have a good attitude and smile and greet the Domenicans and guests they will return the favor to you. Any questions just E-mail me.

There is something for everyone there.We did the horseback riding offered by the resort which was fun and other trips recommended by the resort and we all had a great time.We would return to this resort again and have already highly recommended it to everyone.Thanks for a great time.MaryellenManalapan, NJ

<Author>oom
<Content>Very Different, but had a GREAT time My wife and I visited Punta Cana for the first time the week of July 11 thru 15. We have been to many 3rd world countries so we had a rough idea what to expect. Overall we were pleased with our stay at the Grand Paradise Bavaro. Most of the staff were friendly and we did'nt have a problem with rude guest as many have. ARRIVAL: Yes, the airport arrival area is outside and you do have to walk a little, but who cares. Have $10 apiece airport tax ready and a pen to fill out their form. We recieved our luggage very quick and were promtly met by our vacation representative and escorted to our bus. You have around a 45 min ride from airport. The roads are terrible and they drive crazy, but this is a 3rd world country and it's to be expected.CHECK IN: Check in was smooth. They grabbed your bags from the bus and waited for your room assignment. We asked for a upgrade and received one very easily. The desk people were helpful, I have no idea why people complain about them. I guess some people think they are rude because they don't speak alot of English, remember you are no longer in the USA. ROOMS: The rooms were OK but nothing fancy. They were very clean. If you tip daily you will receive service daily. The cleaning routine is a little different than what you might expect. They do small chores all day long. So don't worry if you go into your room and the bed has been made but no new towels or drinks, they will come. I have no idea what poeople are talking about as far as the air conditioning. I keep my home around 70 degrees, and our room was about that. We were in building 5 and the AC stayed on all day without inserting any card. The walls and ceiling were cracking, but it's concrete and it's going to crack. Remember people, your not going to get a 5 STAR room in a 3rd world country. They only give you 1 room card, so don't lock yourself out while your wifes sleeps like I did. She could,nt hear me beating the door down, so I had to go to front desk for a new one and they promtly turned off the one I left in the room.FOOD: Very, very, very BLAND. No flavor at all. This is the 1st carribean island I've been to with bland food. We love SPICY food, so we were disappointed. The food at the buffet was the worse there, however, it was very warm contrary to what other people wrote. There were a few flies, but you are outside and that's to be expected. If people kept the doors closed it would help with the fly problem. Service was terrible most of the time, but I DID NOT feel it was because we were Americans. The a la carte restaurants were alot better. We had no problems booking reservations and we booked them daily. I recommend booking them all at once though. We did'nt get sick like many people, but having been to many 3rd world countries we are used to different types of food handling and prep.BEACH: One of the BEST beaches I've been to. The white sands were beautiful. The water was clear but I've seen much clearer. The best part was the roughness. If you stepped 5 foot out in the water it would nock you on your butt. 20 feet out and you were shoulder high in water, you won't find this on many beaches. The under current was very bad, but we had a blast with it. The cuurent would pull you 10 feet out and throw you 20 feet back in. It is dangerous for kids or drunks though.POOL: Very big and clean most of the time, but we stayed on the BEACHTOWELS: We brought our own beach towels so we only used theirs once. The one time we did use theirs it was a problem. We gave them our towel cards and received towels with no problems. When we returned them, they were out of cards, so we had to keep our towels until the next day. How can they not have cards for the towels given out? Where did they go? It's $15 per towel if you lose them. BARS: El Presidente beer is the only drink worth having. All other drinks are terrible. If you want a Pina Colada that is even simi frosted you better get up at 7AM. The drinks are pre mixed so they are sweet. They pump them all day long so they want stay cold. The machines are also to small to handle the load demand. If you don't ask for rum in your drink, you won't get it. The lines were not long and we never had to wait.CHECK OUT: Quick and simple. Our tour bus was very late picking us up. The bell hop got us a ride with another tour bus that was picking people up.Many thanks go out to him for that.EXCURSIONS: We had a couple of good excursions but most of them very very late if they show up at all. They are all on Dominican time or something, it's crazy. I do recommend the Jurassic Safari all day tour. Roberto and Damian were great. They take you on a excellent tour of the Dominican Republic countryside. The Dominican kids are great. When they hear the tour trucks or 4 wheels, they come running out of their house to wave at you. Bring candy or something to give to them. Most tour groups donate part of their procedes from merchandise sales to the schools . They kids really appreciate this.OVERALL: I would visit the Punta Cana again allthough I would try a different resort, not because I dislike Grand Paradise, but because I like trying different resorts. Nice staff, but service is very very very inconsistant.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>For the cost it was more than worth it I'll start by saying that my husband and I are very laid back and it would take a lot to ruin our vacation. If you aren't easy going, I don't recommend this resort. We however did have a wonderful trip!!As you read through reviews, you will pick up a lot of information. Try to take some notes on other people's experiences to get the most out of your trip.When you get off of the plane, make sure you have a pen and a $10 bill for each person traveling with you to get your tourist card. If you are prepared and can fill out your cards quickly, you will avoid lines.We took a taxi to our hotel. It was $26 which we read was typical. The taxi drive was a little nerve racking (crazy drivers!!) but definitely an experience.The hotel was nice. We were put in bldg 3. Bldg 3 and Bldg 6 are definitely the best-being both close to the pool and the beach. Try to stay away from bldgs 1  2....lots of construction next door.Rooms were okay...nothing spectacular. There seems to be a lot of complaining in reviews about the key situation. We did not find it to be a problem. In fact, for someone who always loses her room key in the room, it was a help!Food was okay. Couple of tips though. We stayed away from the buffet Laguna as much as we could. Everything else seemed okay. The first day we had lunch at La Cana. Pizza and chicken was good. From the other reviews we thought we would have swarms of flies. Flies were not a problem. Yes there were some....but what do you expect...you are outside???Every day from there on we went to the Club (sister resort). Take the blue trolley in front of the resort. It comes every couple of minutes (pretty ride). We ate breakfast and lunch here everyday. It was an a la carte menu and much better than the buffet. Breakfast you have your choice of pancakes, french toast, eggs, omelets, bacon, ham and hash browns. Always fresh fruit too!! Pineapple and Watermelon was great.Lunch is also a la carte. Their soup is awesome!!! The chicken soup they serve everyday and it was great. They also have a soup of the day that was very good. Wait staff in this restaurant is very good...especially Carlos and Winston.For dinner, we had no problem making reservations. If you get to La Cana at 8:50 you will probably be the 1st person in line and be out of there in 15 minutes. We were able to book a couple of days at a time. We went to the Asian, Italian and the Manglar. We were not fans of the Italian. Asian and Manglar very good. Enjoyed the chateaubriand at the Manglar....excellent!! We spent a lot of time in the pool at the club and the pool bar. The beer was good. I was not a fan of the mix drinks...too sweet for me, but very strong. There were a lot of kids at the other pool at the grand paradise so we didn't spend much time there.We did try to take an excursion to Santo Domingo twice. Two days we got up (at 5:30 am) and no bus showed up. That was a bummer. We did of course get a full refund. It wasn't the hotel's fault but the tour company. When you book your excursion-make sure to get the phone number you should call if no one shows up to get you.We walked to the beach market one day and that was an experience!!! If you go out to the beach and turn right, walk about an hour and you are there. We took a taxi back for $16. I would go do it for the experience but make sure you are ready to bargain. You should expect to pay 1/2 to 1/4 of the price they start at. Don't get lured in by the cigar guys...they are fake.We had no problems at all getiing chairs at the pool or cabanas on the beach. We had no problem getting drinks at any of the bars.We went to the spa for massages and although they weren't the best massages in the world, still relaxing.Pools were clean and the grounds were well kept. We also really enjoyed the bar at the club outside of the Manglar restaurant. Very comfy seats and great music!!Overall, we had a wonderful time. Yes, there were some little things that I could of let bother me but for $650 for 5 nights, you couldn't go wrong!!! If you are American you will be the minority. If you don't have an open mind to other cultures (ie. topless sunbathing, speedos, etc) don't go here. If you need a quick, cheap vacation....this is a great place!! Feel free to e-mail with any questions!!!

<Content>Fantastic wedding in paradise We stayed at this hotel from 16th to 30th June. On arrival we checked in and went immediately to our rooms which were ready. The only problem was the sliding doors to the wardrobe which stuck, we never complained about them, we figured that we could live with it for a couple of weeks. Our rooms were always cleaned daily and fresh towels left. We tipped the maid most days. We requested a kingsize bed when we booked but got two doubles - no problem. My partner and I went alone and got married half way through our stay. It was perfect. We asked another couple who arrived on the same day as us to be our witnesses (Hi Del and Michelle). We had a meeting with our holiday rep and the hotel wedding organiser who were both very helpful. I choose flowers from the broucher but asked for a little pink to be included to match my dress. Both the bouquet and floral displays were beautiful. These were then taken to the Italian restaurant and put around our table ready for when we arrived for our evening meal. The hairdresser in the beauty salon did a grest job with my hair even though we couldn't speak the same language, and it stayed in til I took it out in the morning. The whole day was perfect although the time of the wedding is dictated by the judge. The hotel photographer takes photos (10 included in our package and the rest are $5 each) but we were introduced to Kristian Thomas by our holiday rep who does wedding photography and vidoes (dvd). (---------) Kristian and his friend who took the photos were so friendly and helpful and we have a fantastic album and wonderful dvd of our special day.We thought the food was great with lots of choice and my husband is really fussy!!! neither of us got upsets stomaches due to the food. We didn't take our children away with us but there would have been plenty that they would have eaten. We drank lots of water and juices while in the sun and enjoyed the alcoholic beverages in the evening. Ice is no problem and they only use purified water for food and drinks.We ate in each of the restaurants and enjoyed all, except the service was very slow in the seafood restaurant and they tried to give us a second course of soup when we were actually waiting for our main meal. The atm was out of order at our hotel most of the time but it's only a short walk to Breezes next door where they have a atm and bank. Some of the staff are really friendly and helpful, but others not. The guys walking around the resort in white VIP shirts are trying to get you involved in a time share sort of thing, but most continue to be friendly when you explain your no interested. Beach and pool were great and clean. The resort was not over crowded but did get busier over the weekends. As English people we wanted to go somewhere where we would meet alot of different nationalities and this hotel was perfect. (Breezes next door appeared to be mainly English, very noisey, with lots of families with small children)During the second week I became poorly with a summer cold and sore throat and had to cancel a trip we planned. The next day the reception called our room to ask how I was, did i need to see the doctor? would we like to book any of the restaurants for our evening meal? They couldn't have been more helpful.On checking out the hotel manager asked to see us. He asked if we had enjoyed our holiday and did we have any suggestions for improvements to the hotel. He also asked if any one member of staff had made our stay more enjoyable. We told him that Orderley in the piano bar had always been friendly and gave good service. (Don't miss Antonio, the piano player singing in Japanese!!!!!!!)We also visited the nightclub on various occasions and enjoyed the atmosphere and different music. We had read many of the reviews before we went but decided to make judgements for ourselves. I'm so pleased we did, the worst thing about the holiday was when we had to come home. We'd go back tomorrow.

If you do go to this hotel, meet up with Elias in the main buffet, he was the only good server there, and don't forget the egg guy who speaks no English but does amazing things with a spatula!P.S for anyone complaining about being sick, it is not neccessarily the resort, just keep in mind you are in a 3rd world country, sitting in the sun all day, drinking and eating different food, that's what most people get sick from, NOT from a specific resort.Hope this review helps if you're deciding to go here.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Amazing Beach - Not so Amazing food First of all, when you land in Punta Cana, be prepared. The airport is enitrely outside, there are few walls ans the humidity is insane! so dress accordingly.( The only AC you'll find there is at the departing terminal ) Once you get you luggage, HOLD ON TO IT! There are MANY helpful young men around wanting to carry your bags for you...they also expect a tip. You have about a 50 foot walk to your bus. You can hack it. The ride to grand paradise is about 30- 45 minutes. You may have to drop other travelers off at their hotel, so it may take longer. Once you arrive at Grand Paradise you wait....and wait..to be checked in. Once you reach the counter, don't expect friendly service if you are American. The Spanish speaking visitors and the French seem to rule here. As an American you will be a minority. You'll be handed an envelope containing info about the hotel/resturants/bars, and a map of the place. that's it you're on your own. Look for Jose. He's a bellhop who knows some english and was EXTREMELY helpful. He not only pointed out where lunch was (our room wasn't ready yet) he walked us there, and told us to avoid men in the white shirts. I asked why and he smiled and said oh you'll find out. lunch was alright - don't expect a five star buffet. Most of the food was repeatative throughout the vacation. Most of the food is also very bland. If you're not a big salt user, you will be. We ate at the lunch buffet twice. We found the burgers and fries and baked ( it was so fried) chicken at the beach grill so much better. You'll find that during the day you're not that hungry - its so hot! Youll find some comfort at the pool bar during the day. Great drinks! But watch them make it, they might forget the rum! Breakfast buffet was great - dont expect the IHOP. Look for the omlet guy in the back, the pancakes were a little dry, but still good. The crossiants were excellent. Surprisingly the best thing on the island was the bread. The dinner buffet is O.K. they have theme nights every night, stay far away from the seafood though, I got very ill after eating some There is a pasta station loacated in the back. Amazingly it is very good, stick with the pasta if you can. We tried the La Cana grill for dinner, we left mid-meal. it took them 35 min to take our order and then my salmon was tough, not flaky and soft, and my boyfriends steak was all fat. We also tried the italian resturant, very good! a definite must. Friends of ours tried the Asian resturant they said it was awesome. Definitely go a la carte! TIP* Wake up at 8:30 to go make reservations at the la cana grill for all the resturants. Other wise youll be waiting in a long line and everything will be taken. The room was ALWAYS cleaned for us on days we tipped and some days we didnt. They mop the floors with bleach...my luggage was on the floor and now has a bleach stain, careful!. We didnt get a king size bed like we asked for, we got 2 doubles. oh well we were in paradise who cares? The beach was amazing! if you walk to the left you pass breezes resort and then its just open unspoiled beach! To the right is all the other resorts and about an hours walk down the beach are a bunch of shops and captian cooks resturant. Go with friends if you take the walk because all of the beaches are public in punta cana. We took the horseback riding excursion...bring bug spray!!! The gift shop was okay..but make sure you have all kinds of bills and coins...apparently the cashier doesnt have change dont fall for it, she wants the money for herself. I read reviews about people getting sick and i got worried, i brought along immodium advance and pepto bismouth...still i felt very ill, string stomach cramps and the constant need to be near a toilet didnt spoil my vacation, we did try to laugh about it, but here i am 3 days being home and i am still ill and going toa doctor tomorrow. i didnt drink any water, and was careful about what I ate. Go figure. My boyfriend did get a small wave of stomach problems, but seems to be fine now. Just be prepared. All i can say is that for a inexpensive vacation, what more can you ask for? great drinks ( Go find Ramon in the sports bar at night - best bar tender on the island!) Awesome beach! so - so service, and decent rooms. Go for the beach not the food! and bring the Pepto!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nothing but the truth.... My boyfriend and myself visited the Grand Paradise Bavaro from Mar.13-20. Yes, I know alittle late in writing the review but after reading some of the negative reviews that others have left behind, I figured that someone might looking into visiting this resort should have a truly unbiased review.I, myself have traveled quite extensively but this was my first time at an all-inclusive. The resort was beautiful and the staff were more than accomodating. All the staff we encountered went out of their way to make small-talk and to ensure that you were truly enjoying yourself. My advise is not to brush these people off. Take the time and talk to them. Also, be sure to leave little gifts (chocolate, bubble gum, etc.) or tip the maids daily. Nothing to large but enough. Some people forget that the Dominican is a 3rd world country and that their natives aren't as privilaged as us North Americas. Also the grounds were clean and a welcomed sight after a cold winter. All of the grounds were well maintained (pool included). There was never any vomit in any of the pools. We didn't spend much time by the pools but when we did we enjoyed ourselves. The pools were never overly busy. But do go check out the Club Paradise Bavaro's pool. FAN-TAS-TIC....much quieter and less children running around. As for the beach....it was magnificant. And yes the palm huts do tend to be quite full after breakfast but with alittle persistance you'll be sure to find one. There was never any rocks or reef pieces of any kind in the sand. So you don't have to worry about that. But if topless sunbathing women offend you, then perhaps this isn't the resort to be visiting. There are many europeans who were visiting at the same time we were, but it never bothered us in the least. But overall the beach was truly the best thing there. The rooms were clean and efficent. Never had a problem with it. What really impressed us was that the ceiling in our bathroom was leaky upon arriving and was repaired the next morning without us having to mention it. Maids did a great job cleaning *tip, tip, tip, tip*. Also our fridge was always re-stocked. In fact we had so much pop that we had to give some away to the construction workers one afternoon. So if you're not big pop drinkers definitely suggest giving the pop to the workers. They were very appreciative and once again pop is something they cannot afford at times. As for the food, it was fine. If you are expecting a 5 star restaurant...the buffet is not it. Always a great selection and for those who mentioned that the food was always cold...not the case. Temperature of the food was fine. I expect if you are the very last ones to eat at any meal, then yes it might be cold. And yes there are flies...but once again you are in the tropics! They are going to be flies. The utensils were never dirty nor were the cups. Plus the staff were very friendly and always helped us look for an empty CLEAN table when we walked in. The only down side to this trip was that both of us became ill on our 2nd last day. We had it narrowed it down to a boiled egg both of us shared for breakfast that morning. So word to the wise...is to steer clean of the boiled eggs. In fact I was still ill when I returned home for a few weeks. Nothing too serious and it cleared up after seeing my naturopath. But the whole illness issue never really changed my out-look on the resort. We can get food poisoning from any establishment that we eat at, so it's not all that uncommon.The one thing that I've been meaning to say throughout this whole review is to remind yourself that you are visiting a 3rd world country. Yes things are different. Yes, they do construction throughout the night (we do too..), yes the Dominicains are more forward and finally yes, the food is different as well. But please when you do go, keep an open mind. These people will work their hardest to ensure you are looked after.Overall a great resort to visit!!!
